[{'created': '2019-08-17 03:56:01.000000000', 'message': "py3: Switch swift-dsvm-functional-py3 to run tests under py3

Now that all but one test file is ported (and its tests are all skipped
on our DSVM jobs, since we don't set up s3api), we may as well run
all-py3.

commit_message:
py3: Switch swift-dsvm-functional-py3 to run tests under py3

Now that all of the func tests are ported, we may as well run all-py3.

Change-Id: Ib9f75ca9efb46dc4c7730ad2718228ec7777c924

commit_message:
Use fluentd image labels

In order to orchestrate smooth transition to fluentd 0.14.x
aka 1.0 stable branch aka td-agent 3
from td-agent repository - use image labels (fluentd_version
and fluentd_binary).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676411
Change-Id: Iab8518c34ef876056c6abcdb5f2e9fc9f1f7dbdd

Change doc publishing to a promote job so that we do not need to rebuild
docs in the post pipeline.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008610.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677799
Change-Id: Ie9905d27532375d58500a828c6364117b54b1557
'}]
commit_message:
use promote job

Change doc publishing to a promote job so that we do not need to rebuild
docs in the post pipeline.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008610.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677799
Change-Id: Ie9905d27532375d58500a828c6364117b54b1557

commit_message:
Capture console logs from failed server create

In the cinder resource creation we have been timing out ssh connection
tests to the test server. Unfortunately all of the existing logs I can
find indicate that this server is fine. Lets dump the console log to see
if that gives us any more info when ssh connectivity times out.

Change-Id: Ife397941deab80658fff375846a690a46a0c8b02

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

The detail is described in the following links:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: I6aba9d03ad3cadba7bbd41ea32091a751889db17

commit_message:
3PAR adds reporting of multiattach support

The 3PAR driver has long supported the ability to do
multiattach of volumes.   This patch updates the
capability reporting to support multiattach.

Change-Id: Ied9f31c7fcab18f09971fd8b732c4fdbdc7b7fde

[{'created': '2019-08-19 17:53:08.000000000', 'message': 'Stop treating .gz files as special in log handling

With our switch to swift hosted logs files ended in .gz are no longer
equivalent to the filenames without the .gz. Swift expects us to be
speific. For this reason normalize on using the actual file names as
stored and reported rather than removing the suffix for human
friendliness.

Change-Id: I88ec2eea371fd82ebfc84a8b403cf6f192e25a5e
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677236
'}, {'created': '2019-08-19 20:07:00.000000000', 'message': 'Stop treating .gz files as special in log handling

With our switch to swift hosted logs files ended in .gz are no longer
equivalent to the filenames without the .gz. Swift expects us to be
speific. For this reason normalize on using the actual file names as
stored and reported rather than removing the suffix for human
friendliness.

Note we keep the .gz less tag value in the tags list. This is because
e-r typically uses tags to identify files rather than pure paths or
filenames.

Change-Id: I88ec2eea371fd82ebfc84a8b403cf6f192e25a5e
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677236
'}]
commit_message:
Stop treating .gz files as special in log handling

With our switch to swift hosted logs files ended in .gz are no longer
equivalent to the filenames without the .gz. Swift expects us to be
speific. For this reason normalize on using the actual file names as
stored and reported rather than removing the suffix for human
friendliness.

Note we keep the .gz less tag value in the tags list. This is because
e-r typically uses tags to identify files rather than pure paths or
filenames.

Change-Id: I88ec2eea371fd82ebfc84a8b403cf6f192e25a5e
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677236

(5 comments)

This looks generally *fantastic*. I have a naming nit and then a question about why a variable was moved, but otherwise this is super exciting.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-23 08:58:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

What happens with jobs like build-openstack-api-ref that have openstack-tox-docs as parent?

We either need to define a separate tox environment for these or ensure that we can disable the PDF jobs for these.

Right now, if let's say neutron has a pdf environment, the PDF would be build for both the docs and the api-ref jobs - and it would be exactly the same PDF.

Let's go back to the drawing board on what we want in this case."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-08-23 09:08:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: -Code-Review

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-23 09:47:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > What happens with jobs like build-openstack-api-ref that have
 > openstack-tox-docs as parent?
 > 
 > We either need to define a separate tox environment for these or
 > ensure that we can disable the PDF jobs for these.
 > 
 > Right now, if let's say neutron has a pdf environment, the PDF
 > would be build for both the docs and the api-ref jobs - and it
 > would be exactly the same PDF.
 > 
 > Let's go back to the drawing board on what we want in this case.

Good catch. Correct me if I'm wrong, would it not be easier to disbale the PDF jobs for these as opposed to creating a whole new tox env? I can't see us wanting one giant PDF with both the api and doc content. As I mentioned in openstack-doc, our primary focus is user content. Not that api isn't, but I don't believe it was really in the initial scope."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-23 10:54:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

I'm fine disabling PDFs for those jobs, this needs a bit of rearchitecture... We can just not inherit from this job... revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-11 10:58:21.000000000', 'message': "Add support for building PDFs

We want PDFs. We don't want to have to go to each project and add a
'pdf' tox target or similar. Get the former and avoid the latter by
adding a post step to the 'openstack-tox-docs' job which will re-use the
environment built for the HTML build to run Sphinx's 'latex' builder and
then build this output to get our PDFs.

Change-Id: Ibc455ba511a877159848f4060a6058800d7d2f9b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

"}, {'created': '2019-08-20 10:32:00.000000000', 'message': "Add support for building PDFs

We want PDFs. We don't want to have to go to each project and add a
'pdf' tox target or similar. Get the former and avoid the latter by
adding a step to build our PDFs to the 'openstack-tox-docs' job.

At the moment, the PDF build is disabled by default.
To enable PDF build, the job consumer should set 'build_pdf' flag to true.

Note that only the job for master and stein is updated,
we do not build PDFs for older releases.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>
Change-Id: Ibc455ba511a877159848f4060a6058800d7d2f9b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-08-20 13:01:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for building PDFs

We want PDFs. We don't want to have to go to each project and add a
'pdf' tox target or similar. Get the former and avoid the latter by
adding a step to build our PDFs to the 'openstack-tox-docs' job.

At the moment, the PDF build is disabled by default.
To enable PDF build, the job consumer should set 'build_pdf' flag to true.

New project-templates "(publish|build)-openstack-docs-pti" are
introduced so that OpenStack projects can consume them.

Note that only the job for master and stein is updated,
we do not build PDFs for older releases.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>
Change-Id: Ibc455ba511a877159848f4060a6058800d7d2f9b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-08-20 14:08:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for building PDFs

New project-templates "(publish|build)-openstack-docs-pti" are

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

Signed-off-by: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-08-21 18:28:42.000000000', 'message': "Add support for building PDFs

We want PDFs. We don't want to have to go to each project and add a
'pdf' tox target or similar. Get the former and avoid the latter by
adding a step to build our PDFs to the 'openstack-tox-docs' job.

The job assumes 'pdfdocs' tox env to build PDF docs.
If 'pdfdocs' tox env does not exist, PDF doc build will be skipped.
The generated PDF file will be fetched to the log directory if exists.

Note that only the job for master and stein is updated,
we do not build PDFs for older releases.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>
Change-Id: Ibc455ba511a877159848f4060a6058800d7d2f9b

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/678077
Change-Id: Ibc455ba511a877159848f4060a6058800d7d2f9b
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for building PDFs

We want PDFs. We don't want to have to go to each project and add a
'pdf' tox target or similar. Get the former and avoid the latter by
adding a step to build our PDFs to the 'openstack-tox-docs' job.

The job assumes a 'pdf-docs' tox env to build PDF docs.
If 'pdf-docs' tox env does not exist, PDF doc build will be skipped.

Note that only the job for master and stein is updated,
we do not build PDFs for older releases.

Do not build PDFs for deploy-guide for now.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/678077
Change-Id: Ibc455ba511a877159848f4060a6058800d7d2f9b

[{'created': '2019-08-23 07:38:30.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Fix periodic jobs for Ironic and Zun

These jobs were smart to define files at the base level
but this makes periodic never pick them up because
there are no changes in periodic.

This patch overrides files in periodic pipeline so that
the jobs can run.

Change-Id: I9e4ae713ad0c5e7ef1e60cc9f00fe4ed117e3e6c
Signed-off-by: RadosÅ‚aw Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Fix periodic jobs for Ironic and Zun

These jobs were smart to define files at the base level
but this makes periodic never pick them up because
there are no changes in periodic.

This patch overrides files in periodic pipeline so that
the jobs can run.

Change-Id: I9e4ae713ad0c5e7ef1e60cc9f00fe4ed117e3e6c
Signed-off-by: RadosÅ‚aw Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

subject: Fix inspector iPXE boot with UEFI compute nodes
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-08-22 08:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-08-22 08:32:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2019-08-23 14:17:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nTested on real hardware. Works as advertised :-)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-22 08:27:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix inspector iPXE boot with UEFI compute nodes

Rocky only

The IPA ramdisk fails to boot on UEFI compute nodes with iPXE. We see
the following error on the console, followed by a kernel panic:

Fix kernel panic-not syncing: VFS: unable to mount root fs on unknown
block(0,0)

The cause is the lack of an initrd=ironic-agent.initramfs kernel
argument in inspector.ipxe.

Rather than removing the kayobe override template as was done in stein,
for Rocky we take the less risky approach of adding the kernel argument
to our template.

Change-Id: I5363cb18b361d450ef8e77c553cc21ee2241ba79
Story: 2006214
Task: 35804
'}]
commit_message:
Fix inspector iPXE boot with UEFI compute nodes

Rocky only

The IPA ramdisk fails to boot on UEFI compute nodes with iPXE. We see
the following error on the console, followed by a kernel panic:

Fix kernel panic-not syncing: VFS: unable to mount root fs on unknown
block(0,0)

The cause is the lack of an initrd=ironic-agent.initramfs kernel
argument in inspector.ipxe.

Rather than removing the kayobe override template as was done in stein,
for Rocky we take the less risky approach of adding the kernel argument
to our template.

Change-Id: I5363cb18b361d450ef8e77c553cc21ee2241ba79
Story: 2006214
Task: 35804

Emit an error for a missing E-mail template

Instead of silently doing nothing when asked to render a message for
an event with no available template, return nonzero and provide an
explanation.

For reasons not worth delving into this close to putting it to use,
we've used "PTL Election" (singular) and "TC Elections" (plural) as
the expected event names in our election tooling. Correct the errant
"TC Election" entry in the present election config.

Change-Id: Ifc588fc7a47738ab8262d5754adc38f7f7ec50d7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix configuration for TC Elections event

For reasons not worth delving into this close to putting it to use,
we've used "PTL Election" (singular) and "TC Elections" (plural) as
the expected event names in our election tooling. Correct the errant
"TC Election" entry in the present election config.

Change-Id: Ifc588fc7a47738ab8262d5754adc38f7f7ec50d7

Some corrections & questions inline.

But mainly -1 because we're not supposed to have transitional states like this where we've introduced new options that don't do anything (in particular, don't do what their help text says).

The introduction of new conf options needs to be part of the final "master switch" patch that enables the functionality built up over the series. "}, {'created': '2019-08-23 16:44:15.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Start reporting PCPU inventory to placement

This requires a lot of hand holding for legacy configuration options
(hence the plethora of tests) but this is all required to not break
upgrades.

A new '[compute] cpu_dedicated_set' config option is added, including a
wall of text necessary to explain the upgrade implications of this
option. The 'vcpu_pin_set' option is also deprecated, while the help
text for the 'reserved_host_cpus' option is updated to specify that it
will be ignored for the libvirt driver.

The 'os-resource-classes' minimum version must be bumped to 0.2.0, as
that's the first version to include the 'PCPU' standard resource class.

Part of blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: I94d9a548ebf1efaf5400a0829ca07fa69047f32a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Start reporting PCPU inventory to placement

This requires a lot of hand holding for legacy configuration options
(hence the plethora of tests) but this is all required to not break
upgrades.

A new '[compute] cpu_dedicated_set' config option is added, including a
wall of text necessary to explain the upgrade implications of this
option. The 'vcpu_pin_set' option is also deprecated, while the help
text for the 'reserved_host_cpus' option is updated to specify that it
will be ignored for the libvirt driver.

The 'os-resource-classes' minimum version must be bumped to 0.2.0, as
that's the first version to include the 'PCPU' standard resource class.

Part of blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: I94d9a548ebf1efaf5400a0829ca07fa69047f32a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add ability to install kernel related packages

Added support to have the kernel class install packages prior to the
kmod loading.

Change-Id: I6085bcd2f91f84577dcf59d3c93afb24ab718a49
Related-Bug: #1840180
(cherry picked from commit cf8dc4658a4dbbffc145c24898be280ca47d902e)

commit_message:
Fix gate failure

Functional test test_vnf_with_placement_policy_invalid failing with
MismatchError on gate due to invalid string check. Please see [1].
Fixing it with correct string check.

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/96/666496/7/check/tacker-functional-devstack-multinode-python3/fae7692/testr_results.html.gz

Change-Id: I3b448067036f122e16826d4729c59a65e70109ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 13:46:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix ceph: only close rbd image after snapshot iteration is finished

list_snaps() returns an iterator object that requires resources from the
Image object. Closing the Image object deallocates these resources.

On Ceph mimic, which contains changes to the functions being invoked,
iterating over the snapshots of a closed image results in the following
assertion being triggered:

cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: In function 'void Mutex::Lock(bool)' thread 7f35a4812700 time 2018-12-14 10:10:49.843120
cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: 110: FAILED assert(r == 0)
cinder-backup[29383]:  ceph version 13.2.2 (02899bfda814146b021136e9d8e80eba494e1126) mimic (stable)
cinder-backup[29383]:  1: (ceph::__ceph_assert_fail(char const*, char const*, int, char const*)+0x102) [0x7f35903440f2]
cinder-backup[29383]:  2: (()+0x3162b7) [0x7f35903442b7]
cinder-backup[29383]:  3: (Mutex::Lock(bool)+0x1de) [0x7f359031901e]
cinder-backup[29383]:  4: (()+0x8f452) [0x7f358dafc452]
cinder-backup[29383]:  5: (()+0x11280d) [0x7f358db7f80d]
cinder-backup[29383]:  6: (rbd_snap_get_namespace_type()+0x29) [0x7f358dacf549]

The lock being tried to acquire and the object that contained it have
already been destroyed by closing the image. The assertion terminates
the cinder-backup service via SIGABRT.

On Ceph luminous we've seen occasional segfaults of the cinder-backup
service, which might have the same underlying cause.

Closes-Bug: #1838691

Change-Id: If6043d82cc57d9247a290816d90b95cdf719eaac
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
(cherry picked from commit 76569672599eda764f946ad6ee2ce0bdaddad36b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ceph: only close rbd image after snapshot iteration is finished

list_snaps() returns an iterator object that requires resources from the
Image object. Closing the Image object deallocates these resources.

On Ceph mimic, which contains changes to the functions being invoked,
iterating over the snapshots of a closed image results in the following
assertion being triggered:

cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: In function 'void Mutex::Lock(bool)' thread 7f35a4812700 time 2018-12-14 10:10:49.843120
cinder-backup[29383]: /build/ceph-13.2.2/src/common/Mutex.cc: 110: FAILED assert(r == 0)
cinder-backup[29383]:  ceph version 13.2.2 (02899bfda814146b021136e9d8e80eba494e1126) mimic (stable)
cinder-backup[29383]:  1: (ceph::__ceph_assert_fail(char const*, char const*, int, char const*)+0x102) [0x7f35903440f2]
cinder-backup[29383]:  2: (()+0x3162b7) [0x7f35903442b7]
cinder-backup[29383]:  3: (Mutex::Lock(bool)+0x1de) [0x7f359031901e]
cinder-backup[29383]:  4: (()+0x8f452) [0x7f358dafc452]
cinder-backup[29383]:  5: (()+0x11280d) [0x7f358db7f80d]
cinder-backup[29383]:  6: (rbd_snap_get_namespace_type()+0x29) [0x7f358dacf549]

The lock being tried to acquire and the object that contained it have
already been destroyed by closing the image. The assertion terminates
the cinder-backup service via SIGABRT.

On Ceph luminous we've seen occasional segfaults of the cinder-backup
service, which might have the same underlying cause.

Closes-Bug: #1838691

Change-Id: If6043d82cc57d9247a290816d90b95cdf719eaac
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
(cherry picked from commit 76569672599eda764f946ad6ee2ce0bdaddad36b)

In rocky and beyond pyldap becomes python-ldap. The structure of the
previous patch to fix them means we must always update the pydep.txt
list with a new release of openstack.

Reordering this we can explictly install only when the version is older

commit_message:
python-ldap fix

In rocky and beyond pyldap becomes python-ldap. The structure of the
previous patch to fix them means we must always update the pydep.txt
list with a new release of openstack.

Reordering this we can explictly install only when the version is older
than rocky. Added openstack releases back to the Newton release for
compatibility.

Change-Id: Ibf88bd2113029d750f9a4f32e288e3d8be3a1bfd

Add dhclient package for Octavia

To support openstack-helm Octavia chart,

dhclient package is added to Octavia loci.

Refer to https://review.opendev.org/630821

commit_message:
Add hosts option to admin authorize command.

During overcloud upgrade we need to be able to specify which hosts
should get the ssh keys during re-provisioning.

Sanitizing host input in enable_ssh_admin: skip empty ip and ignore
extra spaces.

Change-Id: I5868b1f9dcd08bd8135dca3e5d4e3a46d4ebb8cd
Implements: blueprint upgrades-with-os

commit_message:
Remove all unused upgrade tasks.

As we are upgrading by provisioning, we don't need to adjust the
previous version to the new version of tripleo/os as we are starting
from a fresh image and a fresh deployment.

Change-Id: I538f00e86ffcd5813ef4b519b5fc5dd6f3cdbb47
Implements: blueprint upgrades-with-os

commit_message:
Display room capabilities

It is sometimes useful to mark certain rooms as having specific
capabilities like videoprojection. This change adds the possibility
to assign a glyphicon (cap_icon) and a mouseover description
(cap_desc) for the rooms in the schedule dictionary.

Change-Id: I343c28acc3ad6015d3382d526511f153bf38a0e6

commit_message:
Replace ceph_grafana-server with ceph_grafana

This change reflect the tht commit that replace
the ceph_grafana resource service name.
This is required here to retrieve properly the
hieradata resources.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674556
Change-Id: I3eea8d1aa8aa56298add4d17ecad25610698f75e

cool! So... did you test this out already? Is the cert correctly requested and the service restarted when a resubmit is issued?'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2019-08-20 10:22:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Hi,
basically I was able to test a deployment enabling tls-everywhere and applying these patches I see:

1. templates are correctly generated (the last PS is the result of an issue I had on config_settings)
2. the cert/key request is handled properly and I can see on /etc/pki/tls the ceph_grafana.{key,crt} (in the correct path)
3. the grafana container variables are assigned and passed to ceph-ansible as expected from these patches.

Since deploying quickstart+ipa+ceph takes too much time and sometimes fails for unrelated issues, I have no full log of this testing but the list above is what I've seen after a couple of manual deployments."}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-08-20 14:35:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2019-08-21 07:54:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Workflow-1

I think we need more testing before merging this change. revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-29 20:24:52.000000000', 'message': 'Choose first node as bootstrap node name/ip

Previously when Heat was choosing the bootstrap node, it always chose
the first node due to the ResourceGroup ordering.

When it was switched to ansible, the last node was chosen instead due to
unpredictable dict sorting from the inventory.

This patch restores the previous behavior and makes sure the first node
in a group is always chosen as the bootstrap node for the both the name
and ip.

Change-Id: I716bf405d8a020770c178d82cd5e73d76a5c97f1
'}]
commit_message:
Choose first node as bootstrap node name/ip

Previously when Heat was choosing the bootstrap node, it always chose
the first node due to the ResourceGroup ordering.

When it was switched to ansible, the last node was chosen instead due to
unpredictable dict sorting from the inventory.

This patch restores the previous behavior and makes sure the first node
in a group is always chosen as the bootstrap node for the both the name
and ip.

Change-Id: I716bf405d8a020770c178d82cd5e73d76a5c97f1

commit_message:
Restore AllNodesExtraMapData

Commit a7661065743086961b8ef93056b810e7d2a49eda removed the
all-nodes-config.j2.yaml Heat template. This template had the support
for specifying hieradata to merge into the all_nodes hieradata via the
AllNodesExtraMapData.

This commit restores the merge logic so that the merged hieradata from
the parameter value and the calculated hieradata is rendered in
all_nodes.json.

Change-Id: I890bbef764b6bae7cb71cfedaff2ce17829737fb
Depends-On: Ib3838d404b45ae6684ef7e0aa211cb8015271866

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 10:14:58.000000000', 'message': "Handle when upgrade_prepare_extra_params is a string.

If for some reason, the upgrade_prepare_extra_params
parameter is passed as a string instead of a list, then
the string will be appended in the overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh script in
the way 'character' -> -e c -e h -e a -e r -e c -e t -e r .
For that reason we need to add the logic to handle the string
as a list to properly work.

Change-Id: I8c1e671cadd0413a06a67766b0461bdbdeac3d32
(cherry picked from commit d67df9fae060ddfe9d936bdbbad0049c295b836c)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle when upgrade_prepare_extra_params is a string.

If for some reason, the upgrade_prepare_extra_params
parameter is passed as a string instead of a list, then
the string will be appended in the overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh script in
the way 'character' -> -e c -e h -e a -e r -e c -e t -e r .
For that reason we need to add the logic to handle the string
as a list to properly work.

Change-Id: I8c1e671cadd0413a06a67766b0461bdbdeac3d32
(cherry picked from commit d67df9fae060ddfe9d936bdbbad0049c295b836c)

3.6 is more strict about escape sequences in strings, causing
DeprecationWarnings for regex strings. This switches a few to raw
strings that were missed in I0e2bff9cb45974b159aed6a63913a63b1956aa32.

Change-Id: I7b2259a241ba2d4b9c7cbaec237c781d50bf2a6c

'}]
commit_message:
Fix python 3.6 escape char warnings in strings

3.6 is more strict about escape sequences in strings, causing
DeprecationWarnings for regex strings. This switches a few to raw
strings that were missed in I0e2bff9cb45974b159aed6a63913a63b1956aa32.

Change-Id: I7b2259a241ba2d4b9c7cbaec237c781d50bf2a6c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Do not log token in the novncproxy logs
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 13:57:18.000000000', 'message': 'Do not log token in the novncproxy logs

Token is sensitive information so it should not be logged. Patch
If1b6e5f20d2ea82d94f5f0550f13189fc9bc16c4 already hide the token
from the log which printed when the token is invalid. But another log
dumps the whole connection info dict with the token. This patch sanitize
that the connection info dict before it is logged.

Change-Id: I9c2d15906b91ac74c9cfce8061184e91459846a8
Related-Bug: #1197459
Closes-Bug: #1841185
'}]
commit_message:
Do not log token in the novncproxy logs

Token is sensitive information so it should not be logged. Patch
If1b6e5f20d2ea82d94f5f0550f13189fc9bc16c4 already hide the token
from the log which printed when the token is invalid. But another log
dumps the whole connection info dict with the token. This patch sanitize
that the connection info dict before it is logged.

Change-Id: I9c2d15906b91ac74c9cfce8061184e91459846a8
Related-Bug: #1197459
Closes-Bug: #1841185

commit_message:
Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently
merged an update to the undercloud installation that disables
the notification drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This
change adds logic for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2.

Change-Id: I75bb75092fa348dc1c2dc465446cb91d4882cf15
Closes-Bug: #1841100

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-uwsgi to projects

Since ansible-role-uwsgi project is intended to be used as a part of
OpenStack-Ansible at the first place, it has been added to the
referenced projects.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676191
Change-Id: I347efbe6fa84122e240d947716208bbff5048af3

'}, {'created': '2019-08-16 22:36:45.000000000', 'message': "Limit get_sdk_adapter to requested service type

Previously openstacksdk would process the config for *every* known
service type, even though get_sdk_adapter only cares about one at a
time. Aside from just being wasteful, this also resulted in weird log
messages complaining about other conf sections that weren't set up
properly for sdk consumption (which we don't care about). And that would
happen every time we requested an sdk adapter.

openstacksdk added support for restricting a Connection to a single
service type via [1]. So this commit takes advantage of it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/674675

Change-Id: Ib0e43f6c9e28ce4f1ac1831a3e3558c825a372ca
"}]
commit_message:
Limit get_sdk_adapter to requested service type

Previously openstacksdk would process the config for *every* known
service type, even though get_sdk_adapter only cares about one at a
time. Aside from just being wasteful, this also resulted in weird log
messages complaining about other conf sections that weren't set up
properly for sdk consumption (which we don't care about). And that would
happen every time we requested an sdk adapter.

openstacksdk added support for restricting a Connection to a single
service type via [1]. So this commit takes advantage of it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/674675

Change-Id: Ib0e43f6c9e28ce4f1ac1831a3e3558c825a372ca

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 08:39:21.000000000', 'message': 'Disable chrony container by default

Fixes an issue where multiple NTP daemons could be running on the
overcloud hosts, due to Kolla Ansible deploying a chrony container by
default starting with the Rocky release.

Kayobe now overrides this default, to ensure that chrony does not conflict
with the NTP daemon deployed on the host. To use the containerised chrony
daemon instead, set ``kolla_enable_chrony`` to ``true`` in
``${KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH}/kolla.yml``. This will also disable the host NTP
daemon.

To ensure that chrony is not running, Kayobe removes the chrony container
if ``kolla_enable_chrony`` is ``false`` in the following commands:

* ``kayobe overcloud service deploy``
* ``kayobe overcloud service reconfigure``
* ``kayobe overcloud service upgrade``

The play in Kayobe is tagged with ``stop-chrony``.

Change-Id: I89a973c0b600abece79bddcba5a46cc28a4f1df9
Story: 2005272
Task: 30122
(cherry picked from commit 650919f52736b297de50bc48bb7fc71e19cb64a9)

commit_message:
Disable chrony container by default

Fixes an issue where multiple NTP daemons could be running on the
overcloud hosts, due to Kolla Ansible deploying a chrony container by
default starting with the Rocky release.

Kayobe now overrides this default, to ensure that chrony does not conflict
with the NTP daemon deployed on the host. To use the containerised chrony
daemon instead, set ``kolla_enable_chrony`` to ``true`` in
``${KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH}/kolla.yml``. This will also disable the host NTP
daemon.

To ensure that chrony is not running, Kayobe removes the chrony container
if ``kolla_enable_chrony`` is ``false`` in the following commands:

* ``kayobe overcloud service deploy``
* ``kayobe overcloud service reconfigure``
* ``kayobe overcloud service upgrade``

The play in Kayobe is tagged with ``stop-chrony``.

Change-Id: I89a973c0b600abece79bddcba5a46cc28a4f1df9
Story: 2005272
Task: 30122
(cherry picked from commit 650919f52736b297de50bc48bb7fc71e19cb64a9)

Removing it from exclude list will built the containers.

commit_message:
Add / Remove packages to support fluentd

Kolla is adding the td-agent package to their fluentd container. This
package is provided by a third-party and not something we want to
support at this time.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

subject: Ensure timeout on queueing transaction
messages: [{'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-08-22 12:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-08-22 12:47:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 9e6c420f50569ab73ba492cda5ae5c687fee30f2'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-08-22 16:46:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-08-23 09:34:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-22 12:47:27.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure timeout on queueing transaction

If idl.run() somehow throws an Exception, the existing code
would cause the Connection thread to die and then if more than
one transaction was queued, it would hang forever. Instead, we
enforce timeout on queing a transaction and log the exception
that happens in the Connection thread to make debugging easier
and try reconnecting on the off chance that the exception is
recoverable.

Change-Id: I14313df9a59424787230b3fbd630d925323969fe
(cherry picked from commit c3d639ab45f827a19429d107f373fdbd555b4bfb)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure timeout on queueing transaction

If idl.run() somehow throws an Exception, the existing code
would cause the Connection thread to die and then if more than
one transaction was queued, it would hang forever. Instead, we
enforce timeout on queing a transaction and log the exception
that happens in the Connection thread to make debugging easier
and try reconnecting on the off chance that the exception is
recoverable.

Change-Id: I14313df9a59424787230b3fbd630d925323969fe
(cherry picked from commit c3d639ab45f827a19429d107f373fdbd555b4bfb)

commit_message:
Set CephEnableDashboard to false

As per https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673675/ commit added in
stein disables the CephEnableDashboard in order to fix
'you must add a [grafana-server] group and add at least one node'
error but in standalone scenario1 , it is enabled by default.

Setting it to false fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1838460

Change-Id: Idd52b6a74b15314c0f75c24ba8c40f467b003fcc
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Tripleo job template restructuring

Implement new templates to be used by tripleo jobs so we can easily
control what runs without having to touch lots of repositories.

The new templates should also avoid accidental enablement of multibranch
jobs on branched repositories.

Change-Id: I6c307b83ccb42defe147f9705e65f2326d067628
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667423

I think if the project is going to remove the API response translation, then the buggy code should be removed. But at this point, maybe just fix the broken code with less effort?'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-08-19 20:46:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Makes sense'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-08-21 14:09:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

To specifically address the question of whether lazy translation is going away, I guess this patch suggests the answer is "no". The main reason we were looking to remove it was that we weren't sure anyone was actually using it, and this patch is evidence that someone is. revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-19 06:49:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fix translated response

When request has ``Accept-Language`` header, keystone should response
the translated message. Without oslo_i18n lazy translation feature, the
message will be translated before the server knows the language.

Actually this has been fixed previously, like
2167e3612cbb79003cc0b8a98607f346238d7be4

But seems the logic was broken after i18n refactor.

Change-Id: Icb3d9dcd25a5dde0676fc4bd4eaad7b265a0c99d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix translated response

When request has ``Accept-Language`` header, keystone should response
the translated message. Without oslo_i18n lazy translation feature, the
message will be translated before the server knows the language.

Actually this has been fixed previously, like
2167e3612cbb79003cc0b8a98607f346238d7be4

But seems the logic was broken after i18n refactor.

Change-Id: Icb3d9dcd25a5dde0676fc4bd4eaad7b265a0c99d

commit_message:
Adds log_filters parameter to nova::compute::libvirt

Defines a filter to select a different logging level
for a given category log outputs, as specified in
https://libvirt.org/logging.html. Default undef

Change-Id: Ic48afe856ae60654d6cebf627b12509881933c59
Related-Bug: #1840140
(cherry picked from commit 0b0bd400659e5e545173417816ec346249f4860e)
(cherry picked from commit 749e4fbb25d71fb04883bb70f61676cca71df6de)

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Also fix the CI failure due to:
https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.5.html#pep-479-change-stopiteration-handling-inside-generators

Change-Id: Ica582f99730c5019a1212d4f58d7d854ad2996fd
Story: #2005924
Task: #34254

commit_message:

"Error ENOENT: all mgr daemons do not support module 'dashboard',
pass --force to force enablement"

commit_message:
Fix default value for possible missing scope_id inside a DataFrame

Since DataFrame/DataPoint implementation patch we cannot guarantee
anymore that a DataFrame does contain a scope_id therefore
the __UNDEF__ default value has been retained to maintain
backward compatibility if it would occur being absent

Change-Id: I77d522c71a319eb569c0d9ef055b4d973143c519

commit_message:
Fix listing security groups when no rules

When listing security groups in the dashboard and
one or more security groups had no rules it failed
because python throws a KeyError.

This commit changes the neutron API wrapper in horizon
to ensure ensure rule information in SG always exists.

Closes-Bug: #1840465
Co-Authored-By: Tobias Urdin <tobias.urdin@binero.se>
Change-Id: I6e05a7dc6b6655514ee2bff6bd327da86f13900a
(cherry picked from commit cdb191ec83f86dffade56be07ca53077d7c78b14)

commit_message:
Fix quoting in zuul for tempest plugins

Something has changed and the quoting used in the zuul jobs
configuration no longer works. This patch removes the excess
quoting.

Change-Id: I4c6c3b1d0e0c38c8130440c2b6c162fd65532179
(cherry picked from commit e17325dd3bcedffe0b1a96c02b00e918d191a743)

commit_message:
Add support for empty or missing "extra_args" in metrics config file

This allow to have an empty or missing "extra_args" key in the monasca
and prometheus collectors, which allows lighter configuration.

Change-Id: I4d384ed980b82f530f9a7ddca32955c5d6be932e

commit_message:
shade 1.32.0

Master branch for this library was not released since March.
Libraries should be regularly released to make their new features
available to consumers.

This change was generated semi-automatically. If there is a good reason
to hold on releasing this (like if you are waiting for a specific
feature or bugfix to land before releasing), please -1 this.

commit_message:
Do not install default plugins for mixed installs

We set tempest_plugin_install_source to true for debian distro installs.
This var allows to install tempest plugins from source, since package is
missing most part of them. However we don't want tests to interfer,
so we're skipping installation of already existing plugins in distro
package.

Change-Id: Id6e38be48f082bfa6d75741ee6e0f9632142c960

commit_message:
Don't stop mariadb slaves if they aren't running

Stein only

If mariadb is not running on all of the slave nodes during a deploy,
reconfigure or upgrade, then currently the "remove restart policy from
slave mariadb" handler will fail on nodes where the container does not
exist. A valid use case for this is when scaling out the cluster, but it
could also happen if the slaves are down for some other reason.

This change checks if the mariadb container exists on slaves, and skips
all shutdown related tasks on slaves where it does not.

Change-Id: I9a191da0ec6ac13ec6dd882b1723d3686f9edc8c
Closes-Bug: #1840764

commit_message:
Fixes wrong local_setting.py file issue for Ubuntu binary deployment.

This bug both affects Rocky and Stein. local_setting.py was not
linked to local_settings under /etc/openstack-dashboard so Horizon
runs with default settings.

Change-Id: I818876619694695663c98d9edcb8c8514198e8fd
Closes-Bug: #1803029
(cherry picked from commit eb7c730e057082eadab5c01ef845f65bb5cf47c4)

commit_message:
Add starlingx promote jobs

Add new promote jobs for starling docs and api-ref.

Note that starlingx does not publish to latest and neither has branch
abbreviations setup for publish job, so follow this with promote job.

Change-Id: I769f0199a2a8891f5d10f2b76bee2527dcaa3f31

[{'created': '2019-04-08 18:09:10.000000000', 'message': "Add dedicated auth endpoint config for virtual machines

An alternative to the previous submitted patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/642812

Added a new method to find the public auth endpoint from the identity
provider in the service catalog, and assumes the version is v3 for ks.
I imagine I'll need to edit this to handle other identity providers?
Don't know enough about it!

Added a new config option to specify the keystone authentication
endpoint to pass into cloud-init data.

Heat code currently has several different methods of retrieving the
keystone endpoint to embed into cloud-init data for created
servers. This data is currently read from several different parts
of the heat config file rather than the service catalog which results
in URLs being passed which are appropriate for the heat service rather
than the server. In particular there can be misconfiguration of
servers due to deployments which separate the internal and
external API endpoints.

This patch introduces a new config variable
server_keystone_endpoint_type which if set
(to either internalURL/externalURL) reads the keystone
endpoint directly from the service catalog, if it is unset the
original behavior is unchanged.

commit_message:
Add dedicated auth endpoint config for servers

Added a new config option to specify the keystone authentication
endpoint to pass into cloud-init data.

Heat code currently has several different methods of retrieving the
keystone endpoint to embed into cloud-init data for created
servers. This data is currently read from several different parts
of the heat config file rather than the service catalog which results
in URLs being passed which are appropriate for the heat service rather
than the server. In particular there can be misconfiguration of
servers due to deployments which separate the internal and
external API endpoints.

This patch introduces a new config variable
server_keystone_endpoint_type which if set
reads the keystone endpoint directly from the service catalog,
if it is unset the original behavior is unchanged.

story: 2004808
task:  28967
story: 2004524
Change-Id: I5d8fc5977014b196c34f4a59a30a7525bc778359

[{'created': '2019-08-22 21:44:16.000000000', 'message': 'Allow nova-compute rw access to /dev/net/tun

Contrail Nova VIF plugin relies on Nova (core) code to create a tap
interface before a vrouter interface is plugged. Thus nova-compute needs
to be able to access /dev/net/tun which it cannot with the current
apparmor profile when enforcing mode is enabled.

See LP: #1841111

Change-Id: I31033bc7d95dfce6b677c6e948303f7154395f66
Closes-Bug: #1841111
'}]
commit_message:
Allow nova-compute rw access to /dev/net/tun

Contrail Nova VIF plugin relies on Nova (core) code to create a tap
interface before a vrouter interface is plugged. Thus nova-compute needs
to be able to access /dev/net/tun which it cannot with the current
apparmor profile when enforcing mode is enabled.

See LP: #1841111

Change-Id: I31033bc7d95dfce6b677c6e948303f7154395f66
Closes-Bug: #1841111

commit_message:
Pass deployment_options to config download

https://review.opendev.org/673862 allows config_download
workflow to take deployment_options as a input, this patch
passes it to the workflow so ansible_python_interpreter
is set correctly in generated inventory and thus used
during ansible deployment.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675804/
Closes-Bug: #1838540
Change-Id: I993fc09fd571fb93d78ffdbecf1823e806f744f4
(cherry picked from commit ac7ae9e8d638676196c4897a30c978d51a091900)

commit_message:
Unescape IPv6 addresses for ceph_nfs_bind_addr

Currently we end up with IPv6 addresses in ganesha.conf that
are encapsulated in brackets so the file isn't parsed correctly
and the ceph_nfs container fails to start.

Closes-bug: #1840983
Change-Id: I035f945df3ea0519ce8b62daa6d0b313e84a508c
(cherry picked from commit 0478cd8923f3ce23c700aa2efac7a8fe518ab2ea)

commit_message:
Add post undercloud OS upgrade workarounds.

It would be useful to unset some of the workarounds set
prior to the Undercloud OS upgrade. For that reason a new
workarounds section is created post_undercloud_os_upgrade.

Change-Id: I56995623b3430d96d226ff46b4aea62222ab4a9e
(cherry picked from commit ace5a62bf58fe5ed91212da3c379ae1fd1ccf77a)

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'watcher-tempest-functional-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'watcher-tempest-functional-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'watcher-tempest-functional-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35939

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I42b7e5ff5fd64a21bdb8a32f319759a18c173601

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-19 08:19:54.000000000', 'message': 'Allow combining system_upgrade_prepare and system_upgrade_run into system_upgrade

Previously we required the operator to run two separate commands for
the "prepare" and "run" phases of operating system upgrade. This
commit refactors the upgrade_tasks with these tags so that running the
whole system upgrade is possible via a single command with `--tags
system_upgrade`.

Allowing to run in a single command requires being more careful about
what can happen in which step number in the upgrade tasks. The upgrade
steps for system upgrade are now explicitly documented in composable
services readme.

The existing system_upgrade_run and system_upgrade_prepare tasks were
checked and moved into the appropriate steps. In the case of
pacemaker, it required moving the cluster stop/destroy action into a
single file with removing all containers, to guarantee that the
cluster is stopped before the container removal, otherwise pacemaker
would try to spawn new containers.

Change-Id: I3cd78de8d07be46ee01006dd7e039c285991d14a
Partial-Bug: #1831690
(cherry picked from commit 206625d4f5bd9a643e76d7f52e13cc171ee4edad)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow combining system_upgrade_prepare and system_upgrade_run into system_upgrade

Previously we required the operator to run two separate commands for
the "prepare" and "run" phases of operating system upgrade. This
commit refactors the upgrade_tasks with these tags so that running the
whole system upgrade is possible via a single command with `--tags
system_upgrade`.

Allowing to run in a single command requires being more careful about
what can happen in which step number in the upgrade tasks. The upgrade
steps for system upgrade are now explicitly documented in composable
services readme.

The existing system_upgrade_run and system_upgrade_prepare tasks were
checked and moved into the appropriate steps. In the case of
pacemaker, it required moving the cluster stop/destroy action into a
single file with removing all containers, to guarantee that the
cluster is stopped before the container removal, otherwise pacemaker
would try to spawn new containers.

Change-Id: I3cd78de8d07be46ee01006dd7e039c285991d14a
Partial-Bug: #1831690
(cherry picked from commit 206625d4f5bd9a643e76d7f52e13cc171ee4edad)

subject: Configure nova_compute for vendordata
messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2019-08-21 21:20:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-22 20:08:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 21:20:04.000000000', 'message': 'Configure nova_compute for vendordata

The next change in this series turns off the nova_metadata service,
which means nova_compute needs to have the same vendordata
configuration so that it can populate the config-drive data with the
same vendordata served by nova_metadata.

Change-Id: I2dc1d120d0bd7cc91bde767097945598148d3e9b
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy
(cherry picked from commit 3778e6121ba80fcfc8b6d9dea853e43de4dd691e)
Closes-Bug: 1840980
'}]
commit_message:
Configure nova_compute for vendordata

The next change in this series turns off the nova_metadata service,
which means nova_compute needs to have the same vendordata
configuration so that it can populate the config-drive data with the
same vendordata served by nova_metadata.

Change-Id: I2dc1d120d0bd7cc91bde767097945598148d3e9b
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy
(cherry picked from commit 3778e6121ba80fcfc8b6d9dea853e43de4dd691e)
Closes-Bug: 1840980

commit_message:
Change ceph dashboard service name to meet puppet requirements

Since we have some issues on puppet using the "-" notation, this
change replace the service name removing the last part. This should
not affect the ceph-ansible inventory since the group name is still
translated into grafana-server.

Change-Id: I8c449731915e4eb44ff92d85786f47d7707a5651

commit_message:
Fix InfluxdbClientError exception bug

InfluxdbClientError has content attribute no message attribute.
Message attribute deprecated in Python 2.6 and it's go away
in Python 3.0

Change-Id: I5fe4bcb018a7c8c99df29d9798aa0e2736f33b6f
Story: 2005900
Task: 33762

[{'created': '2019-08-16 18:55:25.000000000', 'message': 'Generate static ARA report when necessary

OpenStack CI recently switched to object based log storage, which
cannot render ARA sqlite databases since there is no longer middleware
to do so. The Zuul inventory contains a var that allows us to detect
this situation called "ara_report_type". In the openstack gate, this
var is set to "html", indicating a static report should be generated.

We will now use this var in the log collection playbook to indicate
to that our log collect script should generate an ARA static html
report.

commit_message:
Generate static ARA report when necessary

OpenStack CI recently switched to object based log storage, which
cannot render ARA sqlite databases since there is no longer middleware
to do so. The Zuul inventory contains a var that allows us to detect
this situation called "ara_report_type". In the openstack gate, this
var is set to "html", indicating a static report should be generated.

We will now use this var in the log collection playbook to indicate
to that our log collect script should generate an ARA static html
report.

Change-Id: I74ba6ab2ee329e3c78b470152c7f279fc34e1eb9

commit_message:
Remove experimental openSUSE 42.3 job

The openSUSE 42.3 distribution is eol, remove this experimental job so
that the job can be removed from Zuul.

Note that master has job for newer openSUSE running.

Change-Id: Icd25b8695816f4d89a7aa00a9b9e9387866438f3

commit_message:
zuul: change the cinderlib test runner into a role

A role can be easily reused elsewhere (for example by cinder
and cinder-tempest-plugins jobs).

The role is a wrapper around the default 'tox' role.
In order to make it working, CL_FTEST_CFG needs to be
overwritable completely, otherwise it is not possible
for tests to set a full path.

Finally, whitelist stestr to avoid tox warnings.

Change-Id: I274dd1da499e320e6d63af750cacb25e01df7561

subject: Change heat-agents release model
messages:
[{'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2019-08-08 21:59:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-08-14 00:30:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Kendall. I will raise this in meeting/office hour today'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-08-14 13:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think we still plan to release heat-agent and still like to keep possibility to make second release during cycle. so would prefer to keep it for now'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-19 15:21:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Rico, is there a release coming for this then? Cycle-with-intermediary should have multiple releases during the cycle.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-08-19 17:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Will release 1.9.0 in few hours right after https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665944 landed'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-22 23:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Rico, looks like that patch may have some issues. Should we still hold this? Or abandon if you do plan on getting more releases out?'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-08-23 00:07:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Sean Thanks for pushing all these suggestions. There's already a second release under planning for this cycle, so I think we can abandon this for now."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-23 00:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Ok, thanks Rico.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-08 21:59:57.000000000', 'message': 'Change heat-agents release model

Since heat-agents was only released once last cycle AND it has not
yet been released this cycle yet either, we propose to change it to the
cycle-with-rc model which is better for deliverables that do a single
release per cycle.

There are three options for responding:

1) If you know you will only do one release this cycle, +1.
2) If you know you will do more than one, please release now and -1
this change.
3) If you have no idea when you will release, please please please
propose one BEFORE rc1 and -1 this change.

Change-Id: I877cb4cafb9b1808d064447c4750f917d66496b3
'}]
commit_message:
Change heat-agents release model

Since heat-agents was only released once last cycle AND it has not
yet been released this cycle yet either, we propose to change it to the
cycle-with-rc model which is better for deliverables that do a single
release per cycle.

There are three options for responding:

1) If you know you will only do one release this cycle, +1.
2) If you know you will do more than one, please release now and -1
this change.
3) If you have no idea when you will release, please please please
propose one BEFORE rc1 and -1 this change.

Change-Id: I877cb4cafb9b1808d064447c4750f917d66496b3

commit_message:
python-cinderclient 4.3.0

Master branch for this library was not released since October.
Libraries should be regularly released to make their new features
available to consumers.

This change was generated semi-automatically. If there is a good reason
to hold on releasing this (like if you are waiting for a specific
feature or bugfix to land before releasing), please -1 this.

Change-Id: I1bab91d63ca4e272a0068e26ebc36c554be1d8a1

commit_message:
Avoid driverctl run if the driver is already bound

Check if the specified interface already has the required driver,
if yes, do not invoke driverctl to bind again. If there no
binding, then it will not be added to dpdk mapping file.

Change-Id: I707fd5f02dcbca31d925839a0b2c73b07a2f5974
Closes-Bug: # 1838363
(cherry picked from commit c5ae935753f2bf7ed1b4b8a8f1b536d077e0cc20)

commit_message:
Add noop service provider and use it for httpd

Add noop service provider that we use when configuring Apache in
containers. Supresses actions performed on the httpd service.

Change-Id: Ibed34a9eeecc9d8ab310816e05652bdd5962f772
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Avoid driverctl run if the driver is already bound

Check if the specified interface already has the required driver,
if yes, do not invoke driverctl to bind again. If there no
binding, then it will not be added to dpdk mapping file.

Change-Id: I707fd5f02dcbca31d925839a0b2c73b07a2f5974
Closes-Bug: # 1838363
(cherry picked from commit c5ae935753f2bf7ed1b4b8a8f1b536d077e0cc20)

commit_message:
Add firewall pruning and protocal parsing

The original puppet manifest would prune non-persistent firewall rules from
the save file whenever needed. This change reimplements that functionality.

In addition to pruning the original puppet manifest had special protocol
handling for particular types and states. This change also reimplements
that functionality.

These new functions have been added to our molicule tests to ensure we're
validating functionality.

Change-Id: Ibe4bed6b27cb774dabc40e28a61032bc399c2eae
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: I7dae23ccd677652a05a89346c2dc8f8d9d2dfffc
Story: #2005924

commit_message:
worker: Re-add FailoverPreparationForAmphora

This tasks removes the dns_name option from ports, so that they can be
plugged into a new amphora, which has a different name. This was lost in
change I04d267bd3cdedca11f0350c5255086233cba14ec.

Story: 2006205
Task: 35791

Change-Id: I4230feae5b6f0778b738bddbc69c5a0cd3e6930c
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>

commit_message:
Add Octavia tox tips job template as voting

This patch adds the "octavia-tox-tips" jobs template to octavia-lib.
This will make sure we run octavia functional tests on octavia-lib
using the master octavia code.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/674659
Change-Id: I774212f3161bc3e693beb1d191bcf29ff009b331

[{'created': '2019-07-25 18:30:38.000000000', 'message': 'Document 2.53 behavior for compute service list/delete

With compute API microversion 2.53, nova-compute services
can only be deleted with the ID as a UUID to uniquely identify
the service in a multi-cell deployment. This documents that for
the "compute service delete <service>" argument. The description
of the "compute service list" command is also updated to mention
that the ID can be retrieved as a UUID using 2.53 or greater.

Change-Id: If7d4a27c0aaef588bcd77dd9edddec1e535fbf31
Story: 2005349
Task: 30302

commit_message:
Document 2.53 behavior for compute service list/delete

With compute API microversion 2.53, nova-compute services
can only be deleted with the ID as a UUID to uniquely identify
the service in a multi-cell deployment. This documents that for
the "compute service delete <service>" argument. The description
of the "compute service list" command is also updated to mention
that the ID can be retrieved as a UUID using 2.53 or greater.

Change-Id: If7d4a27c0aaef588bcd77dd9edddec1e535fbf31
Story: 2005349
Task: 30302

commit_message:
Add state sharing and persistence mechanism

For some Redfish resources, emulator needs to keep a state
internally. Given that dynamic emulator is a potentially multi-process
app, states need to be shared across running emulator instances.

This change introduces persistent Python dict backed by sqlite DB.

Change-Id: Ib82485c0cb65a122593308a43eedd257e1e61eab

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-22 18:30:20.000000000', 'message': "Don't assume etcd group exists in baremetal role

The baremetal role does not currently assume too much about the
inventory, and in kayobe the seed is deployed using a very minimal
inventory.

Icf3f01516185afb7b9f642407b06a0204c36ecbe added a reference to the etcd
group in the baremetal role, which causes kayobe seed deployment to fail
with the following error:

    AnsibleUndefinedVariable: 'dict object' has no attribute 'etcd'

This change defaults the group lookup to an empty list.

Change-Id: Ib3252143a97652c5cf70b56cbfd7c7ce69f93a55
Closes-Bug: #1841073
(cherry picked from commit 331d373b996d9e7b7f9e6d9a1fa48821ddf1d62b)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't assume etcd group exists in baremetal role

The baremetal role does not currently assume too much about the
inventory, and in kayobe the seed is deployed using a very minimal
inventory.

Icf3f01516185afb7b9f642407b06a0204c36ecbe added a reference to the etcd
group in the baremetal role, which causes kayobe seed deployment to fail
with the following error:

    AnsibleUndefinedVariable: 'dict object' has no attribute 'etcd'

This change defaults the group lookup to an empty list.

Change-Id: Ib3252143a97652c5cf70b56cbfd7c7ce69f93a55
Closes-Bug: #1841073
(cherry picked from commit 331d373b996d9e7b7f9e6d9a1fa48821ddf1d62b)

commit_message:
Migrate configuration options related to eventlet server from DEFAULT

This patch migrates configuration options related to eventlet server
from DEFAULT section to eventlet_server, as the ones in DEFAULT
section was deprecated[1]

[1] I6dd718c4d54056d0e29978f393ec45f7291f802d

Change-Id: I1a726c706f509f2a2be68098cda8431cddc0fe92

[{'created': '2019-08-08 13:00:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix usage of NotFound exception

All built-in inheritors of osc_lib.exceptions.ClientException expects
3 positional arguments: first argument is code, the second one is
message.

osc_lib.api.api.BaseAPI raises NotFound exception with transmitting only
message arguments which goes to position of 'code' argument.

This patch adds `code=404` argument and passes actual message as
'message'.

Also, this patch adds a hack which check that processes code as
message in case when code is not integer and None was found at 'message'
argument.

Funny fact:
More than 4 years ago, I proposed a similar fix to oslo-incubator... it
was so long...
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/94884 :)

Change-Id: I022bbf3ce4bdd48b3bdcb008ee872c4f62a7b12b
"}, {'created': '2019-08-08 14:42:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix usage of NotFound exception

This patch adds `code=404` argument and passes actual message as

 n case when code is not an integer and None was found at 'message'
argument.

More than 4 years ago, I proposed a similar fix to oslo-incubator... it

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/94884 :)

commit_message:
Fix usage of NotFound exception

All built-in inheritors of osc_lib.exceptions.ClientException expects
3 positional arguments: first argument is code, the second one is
message.

osc_lib.api.api.BaseAPI raises NotFound exception with transmitting only
message arguments which goes to position of 'code' argument.

This patch adds `code=404` argument and passes actual message as
'message'.

Also, this patch adds a hack that processes code as message
 n case when code is not an integer and None was found at 'message'
argument.

Funny fact:
More than 4 years ago, I proposed a similar fix to oslo-incubator... it
was so long ago...
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/94884 :)

Change-Id: I022bbf3ce4bdd48b3bdcb008ee872c4f62a7b12b

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix JSON serialization error on EMS logs

The NetApp cDOT Driver is now fixed to periodically generate EMS
logging messages. The issue was occurring due to incompatible
python 3 code when gathering volume names.

Change-Id: I5ded00b0d743bfb1a9da33d602b9264630979f19
Closes-bug: #1833115

[{'created': '2019-08-21 14:46:03.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate spare_amphorae_pool_size

In octavia::housekeeping class the spare pool size variable
is misspelled and has no effect.  A new parameter has been
added with the correct spelling. The configuration option
in octavia conf is now correctly configured.

Change-Id: I1d72117dfa13c546e3b27ba67fb9e735d0f3b2f3
(cherry picked from commit 6a8720da4fc555b9fb4c7dd29ddedd753f3ec174)
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate spare_amphorae_pool_size

In octavia::housekeeping class the spare pool size variable
is misspelled and has no effect.  A new parameter has been
added with the correct spelling. The configuration option
in octavia conf is now correctly configured.

Change-Id: I1d72117dfa13c546e3b27ba67fb9e735d0f3b2f3

commit_message:
Deprecate spare_amphorae_pool_size

In octavia::housekeeping class the spare pool size variable
is misspelled and has no effect.  A new parameter has been
added with the correct spelling. The configuration option
in octavia conf is now correctly configured.

Change-Id: I1d72117dfa13c546e3b27ba67fb9e735d0f3b2f3
(cherry picked from commit 6a8720da4fc555b9fb4c7dd29ddedd753f3ec174)

is misspelled and has no effect.  A new parameter has been
added with the correct spelling. The configuration option
in octavia conf is now correctly configured.

subject: Officially call it the "U" election
messages: [{'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-08-21 20:33:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-08-22 00:13:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2019-08-22 20:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 20:33:26.000000000', 'message': 'Officially call it the "U" election

Because it will still take some time for the OSF to perform
legal/trademark reviews on the results of the U cycle naming poll
and we want to be able to move ahead with accepting nominations for
upcoming elections, switch to just calling this cycle by the
required initial letter we already know. In official communications
we can capitalize it as "U" but for the purposes of configuring our
release automation the previous names were lower-case so use "u"
here instead.

Change-Id: I0310c0cdbc6492f375e8a1364873ee80edda8e2b
'}]
commit_message:
Officially call it the "U" election

Because it will still take some time for the OSF to perform
legal/trademark reviews on the results of the U cycle naming poll
and we want to be able to move ahead with accepting nominations for
upcoming elections, switch to just calling this cycle by the
required initial letter we already know. In official communications
we can capitalize it as "U" but for the purposes of configuring our
release automation the previous names were lower-case so use "u"
here instead.

Change-Id: I0310c0cdbc6492f375e8a1364873ee80edda8e2b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-20 14:11:05.000000000', 'message': 'doc: remove confusing docs about aggregate allocation ratios

Change Ifaf596a8572637f843f47daf5adce394b0365676 added a note
about the behavior change in Ocata where allocation ratios
set on host aggregates was ignored because of placement resource
provider allocation ratios being used.

Later, change I7d8e822cd40dccaf5244e2cd95fa1af43fa9ed87 added
a lot more detail about allocation ratios in the scheduler docs
including the initial* allocation ratio config options. The note
from the previous change was moved and as a result leads to some
confusion since the doc starts by saying essentially, "you can
use these aggregate filters to manage allocation ratios on a set
of hosts" and then the immediate note says essentially, "oh btw
that doesn't work since ocata, sorry!".

To avoid the confusion, this simply removes the part about how
the aggregate filters can be used to manage allocation ratios.

Change-Id: I62710b0b8c098cca3f67020f4a6da5e684115414
Related-Bug: #1804125
'}]
commit_message:
doc: remove confusing docs about aggregate allocation ratios

Change Ifaf596a8572637f843f47daf5adce394b0365676 added a note
about the behavior change in Ocata where allocation ratios
set on host aggregates was ignored because of placement resource
provider allocation ratios being used.

Later, change I7d8e822cd40dccaf5244e2cd95fa1af43fa9ed87 added
a lot more detail about allocation ratios in the scheduler docs
including the initial* allocation ratio config options. The note
from the previous change was moved and as a result leads to some
confusion since the doc starts by saying essentially, "you can
use these aggregate filters to manage allocation ratios on a set
of hosts" and then the immediate note says essentially, "oh btw
that doesn't work since ocata, sorry!".

To avoid the confusion, this simply removes the part about how
the aggregate filters can be used to manage allocation ratios.

Change-Id: I62710b0b8c098cca3f67020f4a6da5e684115414
Related-Bug: #1804125

Add tempest_private_net_provider_type to allowed_overrides

We add tempest_private_net_provider_type as a featureset_override
in depends-on for scenario7 (ovs) standalone. This adds it to the doc
and updates the outdated link to the allowed overrides.

so that new versions of bandit do not introduce pepe8 failures.

This is capped to version 1.4, same version as listed in
upper-constraints file in requirements repo for stable/pike branch.

Change-Id: Idd2b6254bb4fcf4b168cd35a1a27a9da2ca2280d
"}]
commit_message:
Cap bandit

Bandit is a linter, let's cap the version in a stable branch
so that new versions of bandit do not introduce pepe8 failures.

This is capped to version 1.4, same version as listed in
upper-constraints file in requirements repo for stable/pike branch.

Change-Id: Idd2b6254bb4fcf4b168cd35a1a27a9da2ca2280d

commit_message:
Allow listeners for different protocols on the same port

Added 'protocol' name in the unique constraint list for listeners,
updated conflicting/duplicate entries detection in API.
Added alembic migration script.

Story: 2005070
Task: 29643

commit_message:
Change amphora logging to dedicated socket

In some environments running older versions of gunicorn in the
amphora image, gunicorn can fail to start do to /dev/log socket
issues (timing, configuration, etc.).

This patch sets up a dedicated rsyslog socket /run/rsyslog/octavia/log
for gunicorn and haproxy to use. This should resolve any issues with
systemd overriding the /dev/log socket.

This also bumps the gunicorn minimum verison to 19.9.0.

Change-Id: I1e1ad8fde2ad8c1ffba95b1867afb130503b0a5b

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Fix provider driver utils

The provider driver utils module converts Octavia data model objects
to provider driver objects.
This module had some bugs in the conversion that led to errors and
incomplete data.
Specifically the following conversions were fixed:
flavor_id in load balancer conversion
sni_refs and L7 policies in listener conversion
health monitors in pool conversion

This patch corrects those and updates the tests.

Story: 2006306
Task: 36022

Change-Id: Ia2570b929be1c9d89ca971fb37f036f104fb32f2

commit_message:
Merge (don't overwrite) $NOVA_CPU_CONF

Per the referenced bug, $NOVA_CPU_CONF was previously being initialized
by copying $NOVA_CONF, thereby trashing any values already configured in
$NOVA_CPU_CONF.

With this commit, we merge the values from $NOVA_CPU_CONF in after the
copy.

Note that this makes use of the merge_config_file function, which is
defined in inc/meta-config, which wasn't being sourced from every code
path that hit start_nova_compute; so this commit also moves that import
from stack.sh to functions (next to the other imports from inc/, which
makes sense anyway).

Change-Id: Id3e2baa2221e13f512f8dcf1248e1e15b6a7597f
Closes-Bug: #1802143

[{'created': '2019-08-15 13:09:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix heat-container-agent by setting LC_ALL=C

At the moment, the Python locale module expects `en_US.utf8` to be present.
More recent fedora rawhides only come with `C`, `C.utf8` and `POSIX` locale
options unlike the older rawhides. The workaround is to build the Dockerfile
with environment variable `LC_ALL` set to `C`.

Change-Id: I412dd84f09dc217f2c9d974fe203c296b0710ef0
Story: 2006381
Task: 36184

commit_message:
Fix heat-container-agent by setting LC_ALL=C

At the moment, the Python locale module expects `en_US.utf8` to be
present.  More recent fedora rawhides only come with `C`, `C.utf8` and
`POSIX` locale options unlike the older rawhides. The workaround is to
build the Dockerfile with environment variable `LC_ALL` set to `C`.  See
https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2006381#comment-141003 for a
longer description of the problem.

Change-Id: I412dd84f09dc217f2c9d974fe203c296b0710ef0
Story: 2006381
Task: 36184

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-22 15:37:24.000000000', 'message': "Don't assume etcd group exists in baremetal role

The baremetal role does not currently assume too much about the
inventory, and in kayobe the seed is deployed using a very minimal
inventory.

Icf3f01516185afb7b9f642407b06a0204c36ecbe added a reference to the etcd
group in the baremetal role, which causes kayobe seed deployment to fail
with the following error:

    AnsibleUndefinedVariable: 'dict object' has no attribute 'etcd'

This change defaults the group lookup to an empty list.

Change-Id: Ib3252143a97652c5cf70b56cbfd7c7ce69f93a55
Closes-Bug: #1841073
"}]
commit_message:
Don't assume etcd group exists in baremetal role

The baremetal role does not currently assume too much about the
inventory, and in kayobe the seed is deployed using a very minimal
inventory.

Icf3f01516185afb7b9f642407b06a0204c36ecbe added a reference to the etcd
group in the baremetal role, which causes kayobe seed deployment to fail
with the following error:

    AnsibleUndefinedVariable: 'dict object' has no attribute 'etcd'

This change defaults the group lookup to an empty list.

Change-Id: Ib3252143a97652c5cf70b56cbfd7c7ce69f93a55
Closes-Bug: #1841073

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-15 08:38:21.000000000', 'message': 'Validate and pad server_certs_key_passphrase to be 32 characters long

Fernet checks[1] for 32 characters long key, so Octavia should validate
the value provided for server_certs_key_passphrase, to reject an invalid
passphrase as early as possible.

If the provided passphrase is shorter than 32 characters, Octavia will pad it with zeros.

This[2] Red Hat Bug showed a case in which an invalid passphrase got
configured, and as a result, Octavia was unable to create any
load balancers.

Related-bug: #1833942

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/blob/784676de3381f039f95f998505d45fb9d56bd300/src/cryptography/fernet.py#L36
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1723051

Change-Id: Ia59dd1556494373b425eda3b21bbe65f35c437c1
'}, {'created': '2019-07-15 08:45:16.000000000', 'message': '[Option B]: Validate and pad server_certs_key_passphrase to be 32 characters long

Fernet checks[1] for 32 characters long key, so Octavia should validate
the value provided for server_certs_key_passphrase, to reject an invalid
passphrase as early as possible.

If the provided passphrase is shorter than 32 characters, Octavia will
pad it with zeros.

This[2] Red Hat Bug showed a case in which an invalid passphrase got
configured, and as a result, Octavia was unable to create any
load balancers.

Related-bug: #1833942

commit_message:
[Option B]: Validate and pad server_certs_key_passphrase to be 32 characters long

Fernet checks[1] for 32 characters long key, so Octavia should validate
the value provided for server_certs_key_passphrase, to reject an invalid
passphrase as early as possible.

If the provided passphrase is shorter than 32 characters, Octavia will
pad it with zeros.

This[2] Red Hat Bug showed a case in which an invalid passphrase got
configured, and as a result, Octavia was unable to create any
load balancers.

Related-bug: #1833942

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/blob/784676de3381f039f95f998505d45fb9d56bd300/src/cryptography/fernet.py#L36
[2] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1723051

Change-Id: Ia59dd1556494373b425eda3b21bbe65f35c437c1

[{'created': '2019-03-11 11:25:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix duplicate paths in secret hrefs

Reconstructing the base URL from a request when
host_href is not set must take into account that
an URL path may consist of and endpoint part followed
by a resource path, e.g.:

'http://localhost/key-manager/v1/secrets/25a24d6b-605e-4226-ab39-7e2d8e10f559'

where the endpoint URL is `http://localhost/key-manager/v1`

The pecan.request.application_url is used instead of
pecan.request.url to retrieve the base URL part
(`http://localhost/key-manager/v1`) excluding the resource
path. However, the /v1 version particle is included into the
application_url value because it is implemented by a wsgi
application rather than a pecan controller, so the /v1 bit
also needs to be removed from the base URL when present.

Change-Id: I3c05f3d2f9a970213ca8347d7bbe1aac203af0a1
Closes-Bug: #1749217
(cherry picked from commit ff55d1703421946b9cf515ae59a81b6aed45b6d9)

commit_message:
Fix duplicate paths in secret hrefs

Reconstructing the base URL from a request when
host_href is not set must take into account that
an URL path may consist of and endpoint part followed
by a resource path, e.g.:

'http://localhost/key-manager/v1/secrets/25a24d6b-605e-4226-ab39-7e2d8e10f559'

where the endpoint URL is `http://localhost/key-manager/v1`

The pecan.request.application_url is used instead of
pecan.request.url to retrieve the base URL part
(`http://localhost/key-manager/v1`) excluding the resource
path. However, the /v1 version particle is included into the
application_url value because it is implemented by a wsgi
application rather than a pecan controller, so the /v1 bit
also needs to be removed from the base URL when present.

Change-Id: I3c05f3d2f9a970213ca8347d7bbe1aac203af0a1
Closes-Bug: #1749217
(cherry picked from commit ff55d1703421946b9cf515ae59a81b6aed45b6d9)

commit_message:
Parse glance-image-import.conf if plugins enabled

This change tries to find glance-image-import.conf and add it
to the parsed configuration if import plugins are configured.

Change-Id: Ifcb62c64b3320af176499b337a7277d1a736a03b
Closes-Bug: #1775782

commit_message:
Add Octavia tox "tips" jobs

This patch adds tox "tips" jobs to Octavia which checkout the master
branch of the dependent libraries (octavia-lib in the initial case).
Currently this runs the py37 unit tests and the py37 functional jobs.

Change-Id: Idc5dce9ed609e5bd268588f112637cab151c93bf
