revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-20 15:39:51.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new 'zun-tempest-docker-sql-api-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'zun-tempest-docker-sql-api-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'zun-tempest-docker-sql-api-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35942

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'zun-tempest-docker-sql-api-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'zun-tempest-docker-sql-api-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'zun-tempest-docker-sql-api-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35942

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I3ad4084a6e3298625cbe9267bc84a092f9217c8f

commit_message:
Adds functional test for creating the instance with vgpus

Ensure the vgpus being claimed/unclaimed correctly when boot
and destory the instance.

Change-Id: I6e8e58ee252128abf7f40f02ff357cfa80e197af

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-17 09:27:18.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Using the claim/unclaim_for_instance for mdevs

Implement the mediated device claim/unclaim in the DeviceManager.
The claim and unclaim are based on the usage tracking in memory.

The claim logic is similar to original LibvirtDriver._allocate_mdevs
method. It will try to allocate the mdev from the existing and not
assigned mdevs. If there isn't enough existing mdevs, it will check
with libvirt whether it can create more mdevs. If it can, then creates
new mdev and adds the new mdev into the DeviceManager.

When there isn't enough mdevs for the request, raises
`exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable`. If the request is asking
mulitple mdevs, any one of mdev can't be claimed, all mdevs's claim
should be rollback.

The DeviceManager is initialized in the LibvirtDriver.init_host
after recreate assgined mdevs. Since the populatation of existing
mdevs in DeviceManager depends on that. When initialze the
DeviceManager the mininum version of mdev support being checked,
otherwise passing `False to `support_mdev` param to skip the
populatoin of existing mdevs in DeviceManager.

Using the `DeviceManager.get_claimed_devices_for_instance` to get
the assigned mdevs when spawn the instance. So the
`LibvirtDriver._allocate_mdevs` method is useless now.

Related-Bug: #1836204
Change-Id: I3b9f695e1f596553dbc972d74e8d6d32ea44e47d
"}, {'created': '2019-07-18 03:23:50.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Using the claim/unclaim_for_instance for mdevs

mdevs in DeviceManager depends on that. When initialze the
DeviceManager the mininum version of mdev support being checked,
otherwise passing `False to `support_mdev` param to skip the
populatoin of existing mdevs in DeviceManager.

Using the `DeviceManager.get_claimed_devices_for_instance` to get
the assigned mdevs when spawn the instance. So the
`LibvirtDriver._allocate_mdevs` method is useless now.

Related-Bug: #1836204
Change-Id: I3b9f695e1f596553dbc972d74e8d6d32ea44e47d
"}, {'created': '2019-07-22 11:57:37.000000000', 'message': "Using the claim/unclaim_for_instance for mdevs

Implement the mediated device claim/unclaim in the DeviceManager.
The claim and unclaim are based on the usage tracking in memory.

The claim logic is similar to original LibvirtDriver._allocate_mdevs
method. It will try to allocate the mdev from the existing and not
assigned mdevs. If there isn't enough existing mdevs, it will check
with libvirt whether it can create more mdevs. If it can, then creates
new mdev and adds the new mdev into the DeviceManager.

When there isn't enough mdevs for the request, raises
`exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable`. If the request is asking
mulitple mdevs, any one of mdev can't be claimed, all mdevs's claim
should be rollback.

The DeviceManager is initialized in the LibvirtDriver.init_host
after recreate assgined mdevs. Since the populatation of existing
mdevs in DeviceManager depends on that. When initialze the
DeviceManager the mininum version of mdev support being checked,
otherwise passing `False to `support_mdev` param to skip the
populatoin of existing mdevs in DeviceManager.

Using the `DeviceManager.get_claimed_devices_for_instance` to get
the assigned mdevs when spawn the instance. So the
`LibvirtDriver._allocate_mdevs` method is useless now.

Related-Bug: #1836204
Change-Id: I3b9f695e1f596553dbc972d74e8d6d32ea44e47d

commit_message:
Using the claim/unclaim_for_instance for mdevs

Implement the mediated device claim/unclaim in the DeviceManager.
The claim and unclaim are based on the usage tracking in memory.

The claim logic is similar to original LibvirtDriver._allocate_mdevs
method. It will try to allocate the mdev from the existing and not
assigned mdevs. If there isn't enough existing mdevs, it will check
with libvirt whether it can create more mdevs. If it can, then creates
new mdev and adds the new mdev into the DeviceManager.

When there isn't enough mdevs for the request, raises
`exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable`. If the request is asking
mulitple mdevs, any one of mdev can't be claimed, all mdevs's claim
should be rollback.

The DeviceManager is initialized in the LibvirtDriver.init_host
after recreate assgined mdevs. Since the populatation of existing
mdevs in DeviceManager depends on that. When initialze the
DeviceManager the mininum version of mdev support being checked,
otherwise passing `False to `support_mdev` param to skip the
populatoin of existing mdevs in DeviceManager.

Using the `DeviceManager.get_claimed_devices_for_instance` to get
the assigned mdevs when spawn the instance. So the
`LibvirtDriver._allocate_mdevs` method is useless now.

Related-Bug: #1836204
Change-Id: I3b9f695e1f596553dbc972d74e8d6d32ea44e47d

Adds DeviceManager to the libvirt virt driver, avoid to spread the device
usage tracking code all over the libvirt virt driver.

Implement the population of exising mediated device when initializing
the DeviceManager. The `supports_mdev` parameter is used for libvirt
virt driver to check whether the running version of libvirt supports
mediated devices.

The `_populate_existing_mdevs` will get the all mediated devices based
on the type `CONF.device.enabled_vgpu_types` from libvirt. It also
populates all the guest to get the assigned mediated devices and
update the usage in the DeviceManager.

commit_message:
Populates the existing mediated devices in the libvirt device manager

Adds DeviceManager to the libvirt virt driver, avoid to spread the device
usage tracking code all over the libvirt virt driver.

Implement the population of exising mediated device when initializing
the DeviceManager. The `supports_mdev` parameter is used for libvirt
virt driver to check whether the running version of libvirt supports
mediated devices.

The `_populate_existing_mdevs` will get the all mediated devices based
on the type `CONF.device.enabled_vgpu_types` from libvirt. It also
populates all the guest to get the assigned mediated devices and
update the usage in the DeviceManager.

Related-Bug: 1836204
Change-Id: Ie0aa9cb08c7d5aa7c5a47dbbbfedfc02d8e0be18

subject: Add DeviceManager to the libvirt virt driver

commit_message:
Add DeviceManager to the libvirt virt driver

The DeviceManager avoids to spread the device usage tracking code all
over the libvirt virt driver.

The patch only add the basic interface for the DeviceManager. And
instantiate a DeviceManager object in the libvirt virt driver.

Change-Id: If41122581a1659e15a082862e489cb2a5cb68e45
Related-Bug: 1836204

commit_message:
Calling the virt driver's claim/unclaim_for_instance in resource tracker

The `claim_for_instance` is called inside `ResourceTracker.instance_claim`,
`ResourceTracker.rebuild_claim`, and `ResourceTracker.resize_claim`. It is
also called when unshelve the offload instance which isn't covered by
the ResourceTracker.

The unclaim_for_instance is called inside
`ResourceTracking.abort_instance_claim` to ensure rollback the claim when
the action failure. It is also called when terminate the instance
and shelve offload the instance.

Related-Bug: 1836204
Change-Id: I44bf6845b1b901eb300a33d15c8bb7b438092836

When I first read it, sounded like the allocations were going to be sent back to placement (as a claim), however they are already there. commit_message:
Moves the allocation retrieving early

Moves the allocation retrieving early, it will be used for claiming the
physical resources for `VirtDriver.claim_for_instance`, which is called
by the `ResourceTracker.instance_claim` method

Related-bug: 1836204
Change-Id: I02904df438db4debc318632406aa5267d31895bc

As discussed this morning and as noted in the top patch [1], I don't think there's any reason to have Device/DeviceManager be an interface outside of the individual virt driver. IOW, you could simply do away with this patch -- the idea of having Device/DeviceManager specific to libvirt is fine if that's how you want to engineer it, but there's no need for any part of it to be "common".

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670787/'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-15 22:56:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-15 08:23:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add the virt driver interface for managing the devices

The `claim/unclaim_for_instance` interface added to the virt driver. The
instance object and placement allocation records as the parameters. The
virt driver should base on the placement allocation records to allocate the
corresponding devices. And using the instance object to reference the consumer.

The `claim_for_instance` will return the a list of assigned devices which are
`Device` object. The different type of device should be a subclass of Deivce
object. Each virt driver also can create subclass for each type device if
specific data needed.

The `DeviceManager` is an interface for tracking all the devices for the virt
driver. Each virt driver will create a subclass of DeviceManager to implement
the tracking.

Related-bug: 1836204
Change-Id: Icce24b887127dce1b626f2758234a0db0e4c1be9
'}, {'created': '2019-07-16 06:27:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add the virt driver interface for claim and unclaim the devices

The `claim/unclaim_for_instance` interface added to the virt driver. The
instance object and placement allocation records as the parameters. The
virt driver should base on the placement allocation records to allocate the
corresponding devices. And using the instance object to reference the consumer.

Related-bug: 1836204
Change-Id: Icce24b887127dce1b626f2758234a0db0e4c1be9
'}, {'created': '2019-07-17 09:27:18.000000000', 'message': "Add the virt driver interface for claim and unclaim the devices

There are two reasons to add an resource claim and unclaim interfaces for
the virt driver.

* The placement only know about how many resource available on the node. But
  have no idea on which specific resource should be allocated to the instance.
* The different virt driver has different way to manage the resources. And not
  all of resources supported by all the virt driver. The virt driver should
  implement it own way to track the resource usage.

The 'claim_for_instance' and 'unclaim_for_instance' are added to the virt driver.
The placement `allocation` records and `instance` object are the parament.
The allocation records is used for virt driver to parse the request. The `instance`
object is reference to the consumer.

When spawn the instance on the node, the `claim_for_instance` should be invoked.
If the virt driver can't get enough resource, the
`exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable` should be raised.

When destory and any error raised when spawn the instanc, the `unclaim_for_instance`
should be invoked.

Related-bug: 1836204
Change-Id: Icce24b887127dce1b626f2758234a0db0e4c1be9
"}, {'created': '2019-07-22 11:57:37.000000000', 'message': "Add the virt driver interface for claim and unclaim the devices

There are two reasons to add an resource claim and unclaim interfaces for
the virt driver.

* The placement only know about how many resource available on the node. But
  have no idea on which specific resource should be allocated to the instance.
* The different virt driver has different way to manage the resources. And not
  all of resources supported by all the virt driver. The virt driver should
  implement it own way to track the resource usage.

The 'claim_for_instance' and 'unclaim_for_instance' are added to the virt
driver. The placement `allocation` records and `instance` object are the
parameters. The allocation records is used for virt driver to parse the request.
The `instance` object is reference to the consumer.

The optional `flavor` parameter is used for referencing a claim when
resizing the instance with new flavor on the same host.

When spawn the instance on the node, the `claim_for_instance` should be
invoked. If the virt driver can't get enough resource, the
`exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable` should be raised.

When destory and any error raised when spawn the instanc, the
`unclaim_for_instance` should be invoked.

Related-bug: 1836204
Change-Id: Icce24b887127dce1b626f2758234a0db0e4c1be9
"}, {'created': '2019-07-24 04:04:43.000000000', 'message': "Add the virt driver interface for claim and unclaim the devices

There are two reasons to add an resource claim and unclaim interfaces for
the virt driver.

* The placement only know about how many resource available on the node. But
  have no idea on which specific resource should be allocated to the instance.
* The different virt driver has different way to manage the resources. And not
  all of resources supported by all the virt driver. The virt driver should
  implement it own way to track the resource usage.

The 'claim_for_instance' and 'unclaim_for_instance' are added to the virt
driver. The placement `allocation` records and `instance` object are the
parameters. The allocation records is used for virt driver to parse the request.
The `instance` object is reference to the consumer.

The optional `flavor` parameter is used for referencing a claim when
resizing the instance with new flavor on the same host.

When spawn the instance on the node, the `claim_for_instance` should be
invoked. If the virt driver can't get enough resource, the
`exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable` should be raised.

When destory and any error raised when spawn the instanc, the
`unclaim_for_instance` should be invoked.

Related-bug: 1836204
Change-Id: Icce24b887127dce1b626f2758234a0db0e4c1be9

commit_message:
Add the virt driver interface for claim and unclaim the devices

There are two reasons to add an resource claim and unclaim interfaces for
the virt driver.

* The placement only know about how many resource available on the node. But
  have no idea on which specific resource should be allocated to the instance.
* The different virt driver has different way to manage the resources. And not
  all of resources supported by all the virt driver. The virt driver should
  implement it own way to track the resource usage.

The 'claim_for_instance' and 'unclaim_for_instance' are added to the virt
driver. The (instance_uuid, flavor_id) are a tuple to reference the consumer.
The allocation records are used for virt driver to parse the request.

Due to support the resize action on the same host, the original claimed
resource and target claimed resource are on the same host and in the memory.
There need a way to distinguish the claim. That is why need flavor_id
as part of identify of the consumer.

When spawn the instance on the node, the `claim_for_instance` should be
invoked. If the virt driver can't get enough resource, the
`exception.ComputeResourcesUnavailable` should be raised.

When destory and any error raised when spawn the instanc, the
`unclaim_for_instance` should be invoked.

Related-bug: 1836204
Change-Id: Icce24b887127dce1b626f2758234a0db0e4c1be9

commit_message:
Move enable_nova after enable_ironic

The ironic environment also deploys an ironic configured nova-compute,
however this should not be deployed if enable_nova=false.

This change moves enable_nova after enable_ironic so that nova-compute
is not deployed when enable_nova=false.

Change-Id: Icbc549fac9d83caffb282632e442736cac17ad1e
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 11:40:54.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new 'solum-tempest-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'solum-tempest-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'solum-tempest-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35930

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'solum-tempest-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'solum-tempest-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'solum-tempest-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35930

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ia7da63537eb90750e7b9a2c453e82d248b91037f

commit_message:
Remove OpenShift containers

See I6a73f7f22dda69bef324ffdaecdcd6be693c1257 for the whole context
but we are removing OpenShift from TripleO.

Note: the scripts/tripleo-deploy-openshift script hasn't been removed
yet because we need to update the packaging first in
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/21749 but first it requires the unit
tests to be removed.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-20 06:52:53.000000000', 'message': 'Make the rabbitmq-ready exec more stringent

Currently we use the following command to determine if rabbit is
up and running *and* ready to service requests:
rabbitmqctl eval "rabbit_mnesia:is_clustered()." | grep -q true

Now we have occasionally observed that rabbitmqctl policies commands
which are executed after said exec['rabbitmq-ready'] will fail.

One potential reason is that is_clustered() can return true *before*
the rabbit app is actually running. In fact we can see it does
return true even though the app is stopped:
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl stop_app
Stopping rabbit application on node rabbit@controller-1 ...
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl eval 'rabbit_mnesia:is_clustered().'
true

Let's switch to a combination of commands that check for the cluster to
be up *and* the rabbitmq app to be running:
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl stop_app
Stopping rabbit application on node rabbit@controller-1 ...
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl eval 'rabbit_nodes:is_running(node(), rabbit).'
false

Suggested-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1835615

Change-Id: I29f779145a39cd16374a91626f7fae1581a18224
'}]
commit_message:
Make the rabbitmq-ready exec more stringent

Currently we use the following command to determine if rabbit is
up and running *and* ready to service requests:
rabbitmqctl eval "rabbit_mnesia:is_clustered()." | grep -q true

Now we have occasionally observed that rabbitmqctl policies commands
which are executed after said exec['rabbitmq-ready'] will fail.

One potential reason is that is_clustered() can return true *before*
the rabbit app is actually running. In fact we can see it does
return true even though the app is stopped:
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl stop_app
Stopping rabbit application on node rabbit@controller-1 ...
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl eval 'rabbit_mnesia:is_clustered().'
true

Let's switch to a combination of commands that check for the cluster to
be up *and* the rabbitmq app to be running:
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl stop_app
Stopping rabbit application on node rabbit@controller-1 ...
()[root@controller-1 /]$ rabbitmqctl eval 'rabbit_nodes:is_running(node(), rabbit).'
false

Suggested-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1835615

Change-Id: I29f779145a39cd16374a91626f7fae1581a18224

[{'created': '2019-08-15 14:22:12.000000000', 'message': 'Bump minimum ksa (3.16.0) and sdk (0.34.0)

A number of different efforts are going to need to make use of
openstacksdk 0.34.0 and keystoneauth1 3.16.0, so rather than bump the
minimum in all of those, bump it in one place.

Also, this gives us the opportunity to independently validate some of
the fixes (particularly in logging) we were expecting to affect nova.

Change-Id: I87d1dcd299f6547d5f3c3d77e219bf71aba1cff2
'}]
commit_message:
Bump minimum ksa (3.16.0) and sdk (0.34.0)

A number of different efforts are going to need to make use of
openstacksdk 0.34.0 and keystoneauth1 3.16.0, so rather than bump the
minimum in all of those, bump it in one place.

Also, this gives us the opportunity to independently validate some of
the fixes (particularly in logging) we were expecting to affect nova.

Change-Id: I87d1dcd299f6547d5f3c3d77e219bf71aba1cff2

Previously, we place fd type information in storlets metadata when
building FDMetadata. However, fd type infomation is used inside sbus,
and not used by storlets module directly.

This patch takes fd type out of storlets metadata, and place it
at the top level so that sbus uses only the first level keys, (type,
storlets and storage), which makes FDMetadata handling more simple.

commit_message:
Place fd type outside storlets metadata

Previously, we place fd type information in storlets metadata when
building FDMetadata. However, fd type infomation is used inside sbus,
and not used by storlets module directly.

This patch takes fd type out of storlets metadata, and place it
at the top level so that sbus uses only the first level keys, (type,
storlets and storage), which makes FDMetadata handling more simple.

Change-Id: Ice3e1c3b99a2549b378ee5e896e2fc4241a0169c

commit_message:
Use secure sha256 instead of sha1

Fix for bandit B303: Use of insecure MD2, MD4, MD5, or SHA1 hash function.

Change-Id: I00403d7bd3b40ae00420e6cddcf40f45488284a9
Partial-Bug: #1759250
(cherry picked from commit ab426a791ad1937ea2cf3b340202b3968a378978)
(cherry picked from commit 62f4868e6e240ebbb4d6e29b8c1e1d23a24fcc15)

commit_message:
Add 'tag' support to compute with supported microversion

A 'tag' could be specified for the interface when the nova microversion
is 2.32-2.36 or >= 2.42.
Add support to the 'tag' use.

Change-Id: Ia9f95ef4ed285012e157d758dfbec69df4010350

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 17:57:33.000000000', 'message': "zypper-minimal: Don't get confused by etc/resolv.conf symlink

Newer openSUSE distributions install an absolute link to /run/netconfig
as /etc/resolv.conf in $TARGET_ROOT. as that points outside
TARGET_ROOT, we unintentionally wipe the system resolv.conf here
and break our ability to finish building the image.

Change-Id: I9d5aaa9fad2f81dcabfe19e2f1e6b6e50af597d7
"}]
commit_message:
zypper-minimal: Don't get confused by etc/resolv.conf symlink

Newer openSUSE distributions install an absolute link to /run/netconfig
as /etc/resolv.conf in $TARGET_ROOT. as that points outside
TARGET_ROOT, we unintentionally wipe the system resolv.conf here
and break our ability to finish building the image.

Change-Id: I9d5aaa9fad2f81dcabfe19e2f1e6b6e50af597d7

commit_message:
MairaDB: Move all config to be values driven

This PS moves to drive all mariadb config via the values fed
to the chart.

Change-Id: I4ed3624737af4d5c90b1b5de451a0a0b75a5eda1
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Re-use DB MetaData during archive_deleted_rows

This simply passes the database engine metadata
from archive_deleted_rows to _archive_deleted_rows_for_table
so the latter does not need to get the engine and create a
new MetaData object for each table processed.

Change-Id: If42acd953dc9bd09972e974f7bb04d5bab701a40

subject: Switch to promote docs job
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-21 17:03:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-08-21 22:05:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 17:03:25.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to promote docs job

We now use a promote job for publishing that avoids building again the
documents after merge. use this here as well.

We can only use the promote jobs when the job run in gate, so use the
same file conditions. To make those easier to sync, get rid of the
special tripleo job and use openstack-tox-docs directly.

For further details about promote jobs, see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008610.html

Change-Id: I31fa0d59ce2715abe6c36ecfbca8f6a70aaa60e2
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to promote docs job

We now use a promote job for publishing that avoids building again the
documents after merge. use this here as well.

We can only use the promote jobs when the job run in gate, so use the
same file conditions. To make those easier to sync, get rid of the
special tripleo job and use openstack-tox-docs directly.

For further details about promote jobs, see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008610.html

Change-Id: I31fa0d59ce2715abe6c36ecfbca8f6a70aaa60e2

commit_message:
Use python docstring.

Use the python docstring format for the documentation of the function.
Add the documentation for the parameter and raise error. Remove the
unless variable.

commit_message:
Add an undeploy_roles workflow

This expands a list of instances with provisioned==False, then
unprovisions those instances. It will be run as the last step of a
scale-down or overcloud delete.

Change-Id: I9e9f1327070476326597c42ed14280a2088544bf
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-20 08:28:23.000000000', 'message': 'keystone: drop duplicate -DFOREGROUND

No need to specify this as kolla adds this arg automatically
when using kolla_start.

Note that the commit this was cherry picked from does not apply
cleanly, as docker/services/keystone.yaml is used in Rocky and
earlier, while Stein and later use puppet/services/keystone.yaml.

Conflicts:
       puppet/services/keystone.yaml

Change-Id: Ib179e3bbc827cc438519b19e85bda4a9994376b9
Closes-bug: #1832090
(cherry picked from commit 8eaac3026e54a057287301c8c844b54d2c310bc7)
(cherry picked from commit 1c7b5ff95f0c6f2920aa6749b22e838736d600f0)
'}]
commit_message:
keystone: drop duplicate -DFOREGROUND

No need to specify this as kolla adds this arg automatically
when using kolla_start.

Note that the commit this was cherry picked from does not apply
cleanly, as docker/services/keystone.yaml is used in Rocky and
earlier, while Stein and later use puppet/services/keystone.yaml.

Conflicts:
       puppet/services/keystone.yaml

Change-Id: Ib179e3bbc827cc438519b19e85bda4a9994376b9
Closes-bug: #1832090
(cherry picked from commit 8eaac3026e54a057287301c8c844b54d2c310bc7)
(cherry picked from commit 1c7b5ff95f0c6f2920aa6749b22e838736d600f0)

commit_message:
Remove experimental openSUSE 42.3 job

openSUSE 42.3 is dead, remove the experimental job so that
CI can remove the job completely.

On master this job has been converted to 15, let's not do this on the
branch.

Change-Id: I9dd301b5e03b0d40453acbcf3a8c2d7e2232d026

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-19 15:10:47.000000000', 'message': '3PAR: Add config for NSP single path attach

This fix aims to resolve below mentioned bugs:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-brick/+bug/1812665
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1809249
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1734917

Given a system connected to HPE 3PAR via FC and multipath is disabled.
When user tries to create bootable volume, it fails intermittently
with following error:

    Fibre Channel volume device not found

This happens when a zone is created using second or later target nsp
from 3PAR backend. In this case, HPE 3PAR client code picks up first
target nsp to form initiator target map.

To avoid above mentioned failure, user can specify target nsp in 3PAR
backend section of cinder.conf as follows:

    hpe3par_target_nsp = <n:s:p>

This target information is read from cinder.conf and respective
wwn information is fetched. Later initiator target map is created
using wwn information and bootable volume is created successfully.

Change-Id: I2da5d4a0334f07967af5ff7aaa39a0ecc4b12204
Closes-bug: #1809249
Closes-bug: #1812665
Closes-bug: #1734917

Change-Id: I2da5d4a0334f07967af5ff7aaa39a0ecc4b12204
Closes-bug: #1809249
Closes-bug: #1812665

commit_message:
3PAR: Add config for NSP single path attach

This fix aims to resolve below mentioned bugs:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-brick/+bug/1812665
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1809249
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1734917

Given a system connected to HPE 3PAR via FC and multipath is disabled.
When user tries to create bootable volume, it fails intermittently
with following error:

    Fibre Channel volume device not found

This happens when a zone is created using second or later target nsp
from 3PAR backend. In this case, HPE 3PAR client code picks up first
target nsp to form initiator target map.

To avoid above mentioned failure, user can specify target nsp in 3PAR
backend section of cinder.conf as follows:

    hpe3par_target_nsp = <n:s:p>

This target information is read from cinder.conf and respective
wwn information is fetched. Later initiator target map is created
using wwn information and bootable volume is created successfully.

Change-Id: I2da5d4a0334f07967af5ff7aaa39a0ecc4b12204
Closes-bug: #1809249
Closes-bug: #1812665
Closes-bug: #1734917

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-04 23:57:31.000000000', 'message': 'Filter UnsupportedServiceVersion warning

Add the following warning emitted in functional tests
to the filterwarnings.

  UnsupportedServiceVersion: Service placement has no discoverable
  version. The resulting Proxy object will only have direct passthrough
  REST capabilities.

The warning is emitted because there is not a service description
(pairs of a suppoerted version and a proxy class) for placement service
in openstacksdk.
So set the filter until the service description for placement service
is added in openstacksdk.

Change-Id: Ie3d4a122ccfe1a1022e7aa7604585a727489c5be
Closes-Bug: #1838807
'}]
commit_message:
Filter UnsupportedServiceVersion warning

Add the following warning emitted in functional tests
to the filterwarnings.

  UnsupportedServiceVersion: Service placement has no discoverable
  version. The resulting Proxy object will only have direct passthrough
  REST capabilities.

The warning is emitted because there is not a service description
(pairs of a suppoerted version and a proxy class) for placement service
in openstacksdk.
So set the filter until the service description for placement service
is added in openstacksdk.

Change-Id: Ie3d4a122ccfe1a1022e7aa7604585a727489c5be
Closes-Bug: #1838807

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 04:10:40.000000000', 'message': 'Allow mixing of count and instances

The reason for this change is that users will find managing most
nodes by count much easier, but migrated environments will begin
by having every node as an instances entry. This change allows
them to scale up further by just incrementing the count.

There would be other use cases where only a few nodes need a custom
instances entry, but requiring switching over to instances for every
node would be difficult for large clouds.

This makes the count mandatory as there will always be $count
instances created. If there is also instances entries these will
be created first, then further instance entries are created until
the desired $count is reached.

Change-Id: I52bf5dcf175523dd0998ef2f1d36b6b883259707
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
Allow mixing of count and instances

The reason for this change is that users will find managing most
nodes by count much easier, but migrated environments will begin
by having every node as an instances entry. This change allows
them to scale up further by just incrementing the count.

There would be other use cases where only a few nodes need a custom
instances entry, but requiring switching over to instances for every
node would be difficult for large clouds.

This makes the count mandatory as there will always be $count
instances created. If there is also instances entries these will
be created first, then further instance entries are created until
the desired $count is reached.

Change-Id: I52bf5dcf175523dd0998ef2f1d36b6b883259707
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
Lookup interfaces by MAC directly

Currently the amphora agent will lookup interfaces using the
interface name determined earlier in the plug method. This can
lead to a race condition with the udev interface renaming rule.
This patch changes the interface lookup to use the MAC address
directly and not rely on the interface name.

Story: 2006300
Task: 36013

Change-Id: I5bc21d5abdeb67a3a8ae88456735643463f15694

commit_message:
DNM: Test websockify 0.9.0

Attempt to reproduce tempest failures using websockify 0.9.0 per [1] and
the related bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008562.html

Change-Id: I4112abffc9856edf8ada8d4d5a2795a8c299d149
Related-Bug: #1840788
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677479

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-20 18:15:19.000000000', 'message': "Make expected websock upgrade response more generic

test_novnc was scraping a response for 'server: websockify', which
disappeared between websockify 0.8.0 and 0.9.0. Cut over to looking for
'upgrade: websocket' instead (and remove the config option related to
the 'server: *' value).

Change-Id: Ic2b71ab612c14095ecf35587d7fe420144468c80
Closes-Bug: #1840788
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677479
"}]
commit_message:
Make expected websock upgrade response more generic

test_novnc was scraping a response for 'server: websockify', which
disappeared between websockify 0.8.0 and 0.9.0. Cut over to looking for
'upgrade: websocket' instead (and remove the config option related to
the 'server: *' value).

Change-Id: Ic2b71ab612c14095ecf35587d7fe420144468c80
Closes-Bug: #1840788
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677479

commit_message:
Rsdlib changed providing_pools interface

With the latest changes in the rsdlib in the RSD driver,
The _get_providing_pool(self, volume) method is returning
StoragePoolCollection instance, instead of StoragePool URL. Made
code changes and corresponding unit tests to address this changes

Change-Id: If7d24d2537deecd28400c120a23f3af172e92222
Closes-Bug: #1836121

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-02 04:36:33.000000000', 'message': "Create extras for pypi install

This patch adds a new [extras] to setup.cfg.  This section contains
support for drivers and their dependency requirements.  This allows
a user to pip install cinder and optionally install a driver's
required pypi based library.

For example, if you wanted to install cinder and support the 3PAR
driver, you would use:

pip install cinder[hpe3par]

This installs all of the cinder requirements as well as the requirements
for the hpe3par driver.

The following drivers weren't added to the extras stanza
rbd: No rados library in pypi
drbd:  There is no drbdmanage pypi package
linstor: no python-linstor pypi package
storpool:  pypi package doesn't install in python3 env

Change-Id: I2200ce6f554df0c988eb39521ce4defd75998a85

commit_message:
Create extras for pypi install

This patch adds a new [extras] to setup.cfg.  This section contains
support for drivers and their dependency requirements.  This allows
a user to pip install cinder and optionally install a driver's
required pypi based library.

For example, if you wanted to install cinder and support the 3PAR
driver, you would use:

pip install cinder[hpe3par]

This installs all of the cinder requirements as well as the requirements
for the hpe3par driver.

The following drivers weren't added to the extras stanza
rbd: No rados library in pypi
drbd:  There is no drbdmanage pypi package
linstor: no python-linstor pypi package
storpool:  pypi package doesn't install in python3 env

Change-Id: I2200ce6f554df0c988eb39521ce4defd75998a85

commit_message:
Updating Ceph 404 URLs

Updating to latest URL. Although this is probably
best double checked as this was quite hard to
find and inconsistent since the website has moved
and changed a lot.

Change-Id: Ia6a1c4ae557853dce7ac4cfa1adc3df774121121
backport: stein rocky

subject: ec: log durability of frags that fail to reconstruct
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-08-21 05:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-08-21 12:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Admittedly I do not understand a thing about this, but the code seems not adding any performance impact and otherwise harmless.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-08-21 13:39:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

Header seems legit:

vagrant@saio:~$ curl -g -I -XHEAD "http://127.0.0.1:6040/sdb4/58/AUTH_test/ec-test/test" -H "X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index: 1"
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Length: 84
X-Backend-Timestamp: 1566394648.72902
X-Object-Sysmeta-Ec-Frag-Index: 0
Content-Type: application/octet-stream
X-Object-Sysmeta-Ec-Content-Length: 9
X-Object-Sysmeta-Ec-Etag: e55cedc11adb39c404b7365f7d6291fa
X-Backend-Fragments: {"1566394648.72902": [0]}
Last-Modified: Wed, 21 Aug 2019 13:37:29 GMT
Etag: "eab2c2cecf97b86c5d8b518daf24c84c"
X-Timestamp: 1566394648.72902
X-Backend-Data-Timestamp: 1566394648.72902
X-Backend-Durable-Timestamp: 1566394648.72902
X-Object-Sysmeta-Ec-Scheme: liberasurecode_rs_vand 4+2
X-Object-Meta-Mtime: 1558121315.546175
X-Object-Sysmeta-Ec-Segment-Size: 1048576
Date: Wed, 21 Aug 2019 13:37:55 GMT

extra info is good!'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-08-21 15:41:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

FWIW, the context was that somebody was doing some stress testing, to the point that there were 503s returned to the client, and we saw some log lines like

 Aug 20 17:47:10 sm-s2 object-reconstructor: [worker 2/3 pid=9775] Unable to get enough responses (2/4) to reconstruct 192.168.3.42:6003/... policy#2 frag#4 with ETag 2d6426fa25e4ccf0eda7c0c89a28c8aa
 Aug 20 17:47:10 sm-s2 object-reconstructor: [worker 2/3 pid=9775] Unable to get enough responses (4 error responses) to reconstruct 192.168.3.42:6003/... policy#2 frag#4

and it'd be nice to know whether that's actually indicative of a problem, or just some non-durable crud that a "reasonable" client would try to upload again.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 05:23:32.000000000', 'message': 'ec: log durability of frags that fail to reconstruct

Whether the frag is durable or non-durable greatly affects how much I
care whether I can reconstruct it.

Change-Id: Ie6f46267d4bb567ecc0cc195d1fd7ce55c8cb325
'}]
commit_message:
ec: log durability of frags that fail to reconstruct

Whether the frag is durable or non-durable greatly affects how much I
care whether I can reconstruct it.

Change-Id: Ie6f46267d4bb567ecc0cc195d1fd7ce55c8cb325

commit_message:
DVR-Enable ARP Responder when DVR and L2pop is enabled

This patch enables ARP Responder with DVR routers along with
l2pop in devstack.

Related-Bug: #1774459

Change-Id: I82f628c32f6e38c2419b6ffe90d9f9adf96777b1

commit_message:
Add assert statements for Volume Pagination test to get passed

In the endpoint for http and https, Keystone has explicit
port number.

So, added assert statements by using urlparse for parsing the
hostname, path and scheme of the url.

Change-Id: I38d875c36ba72fd49f9e9f6fbd9ca3160f4821a6
Closes-Bug: #1838530

commit_message:
Remove experimental openSUSE 42.3 job

openSUSE 42.3 is dead, remove the experimental job so that
CI can remove the job completely.

On master this job has been converted to 15, let's not do this on the
branch.

Change-Id: I9dd301b5e03b0d40453acbcf3a8c2d7e2232d026

commit_message:
Remove experimental openSUSE 42.3 job

openSUSE 42.3 is dead, remove the experimental job so that
CI can remove the job completely.

On master this job has been converted to 15, let's not do this on the
branch.

Change-Id: I9dd301b5e03b0d40453acbcf3a8c2d7e2232d026

A relatively trivial change this time.

commit_message:
Add tests for project users interacting with endpoint_groups

This commit introduces some tests that show how project users
are expected to behave with the endpoint_groups API.

Change-Id: I0f32de4ea615c89a7500a8098c44ef543fe45a02
Closes-bug: #1818734

[{'created': '2019-02-26 09:43:48.000000000', 'message': "Move calls to ovs-vsctl to privsep.

The exception handling isn't perfect, but it keeps the interface
unchanged. Its quite hard to include the command in the exception
like we did before, so I am hoping we can just not do that thing.

commit_message:
Move calls to ovs-vsctl to privsep.

The exception handling isn't perfect, but it keeps the interface
unchanged. Its quite hard to include the command in the exception
like we did before, so I am hoping we can just not do that thing.

Change-Id: I9d46e0dc228ed2df9f681c1a2f4dca3c018c7822

[{'created': '2019-04-24 15:02:00.000000000', 'message': 'Distribute direct charm dependencies

Do not rely on system installed Python packages but distribute the
direct charm dependencies as part of the charms wheelhouse.

As the span of distributions we need to support with reactive
charms widens we will run into compability problems with the
current model.

For further reference see discussion in LP: #1824112 and
juju-solutions/layer-basic#135

commit_message:
Update layer wheelhouse with common dependencies

Add empty series list to metadata.yaml to get around charm-tools
now mandating a series list to be present.

This list will always be overridden by charms but building the
layer is part of our gate and we need to unblock it.

Update tox basepython, the build will no longer succeed in the gate
with py27.

Change-Id: If81441d5fb0ed3b8819c4a2814dc20c5e47a8eff

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-19 10:21:16.000000000', 'message': 'Run Validations with ThreadPoolExecutor

The validations are sequentially executed through ansible-playbook and
could take some time to complete. This patch adds support of running all
the validations in parallel through a ThreadPoolExecutor in order to
save processing time.

Without this patch, it takes almost ~5min to run all the validations but
only ~1min10 with the ThreadPoolExecutor.

- Add --worker/-w argument to give the maximum number of threads that
  can be used to execute the given validations
- Python 2.7: use futures backport instead, ThreadPoolExecutor is default
- Use six in tripleo_validator.py for python 3 compatibility

Change-Id: Ia805a556bc26700a3eb520ed72e90b37546901b8
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit fdf79cf4f3ddd68fb5dd985c5fc24ec9ad84e3c2)

commit_message:
Run Validations with ThreadPoolExecutor

The validations are sequentially executed through ansible-playbook and
could take some time to complete. This patch adds support of running all
the validations in parallel through a ThreadPoolExecutor in order to
save processing time.

Without this patch, it takes almost ~5min to run all the validations but
only ~1min10 with the ThreadPoolExecutor.

- Add --worker/-w argument to give the maximum number of threads that
  can be used to execute the given validations
- Python 2.7: use futures backport instead, ThreadPoolExecutor is default
- Use six in tripleo_validator.py for python 3 compatibility

Change-Id: Ia805a556bc26700a3eb520ed72e90b37546901b8
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit fdf79cf4f3ddd68fb5dd985c5fc24ec9ad84e3c2)

commit_message:
Add support for RHEL 8 and start using versionless element

A new versionless rhel element has been added in DIB. Start using
that, and add the RHEL 8 bindings as well.

Change-Id: I65d65f954e2d18d4493486c27f5b049dc7910846
(cherry picked from commit 18788b2b1748ffaa088a23caeec165391d9d7b4e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 14:25:10.000000000', 'message': 'Enable staging-ovirt (fence_rhevm) fencing agent.

This commit extends actions/parameters to generate
fencing parameters for nodes using staging-ovirt (fence_rhevm).

Given instackenv.json content like:

{
  "nodes":[
{
  "name":"ctrl01",
  "pm_type":"staging-ovirt",
  "mac": [
"56:6f:71:33:00:0d"
  ],
  "arch": "x86_64",
  "pm_user":"admin@internal",
  "pm_password":"redhat",
  "pm_addr":"10.0.0.141",
  "pm_vm_name":"ctrl01"
}
...

Here the generated fence.yaml:

parameter_defaults:
  EnableFencing: true
  FencingConfig:
    devices:
    - agent: fence_rhevm
      host_mac: 56:6f:71:33:00:0d
      params:
        ipaddr: 10.0.0.141
        login: admin@internal
        passwd: redhat
        port: ctrl01
        ssl: 1
        ssl_insecure: 1

And the resulting pacemaker stonith resource:

stonith-fence_rhevm-566f7133000d        (stonith:fence_rhevm:(  Started overcloud-controller-1

To have this working 'out of the box' we assume the worst case
scenario of ovirt-engine using a self-signed certificate, so
we explicitly ssl_insecure=1.
Users/Operators should be aware of this and eventually adjust
the value accordingly.

Change-Id: If14e0e0a87cacd857762c955288fd71d052d8bb4

commit_message:
Enable staging-ovirt (fence_rhevm) fencing agent.

This commit extends actions/parameters to generate
fencing parameters for nodes using staging-ovirt (fence_rhevm).

Given instackenv.json content like:

{
  "nodes":[
{
  "name":"ctrl01",
  "pm_type":"staging-ovirt",
  "mac": [
"56:6f:71:33:00:0d"
  ],
  "arch": "x86_64",
  "pm_user":"admin@internal",
  "pm_password":"redhat",
  "pm_addr":"10.0.0.141",
  "pm_vm_name":"ctrl01"
}
...

Here the generated fence.yaml:

parameter_defaults:
  EnableFencing: true
  FencingConfig:
    devices:
    - agent: fence_rhevm
      host_mac: 56:6f:71:33:00:0d
      params:
        ipaddr: 10.0.0.141
        login: admin@internal
        passwd: redhat
        port: ctrl01
        ssl: 1
        ssl_insecure: 1

And the resulting pacemaker stonith resource:

stonith-fence_rhevm-566f7133000d        (stonith:fence_rhevm:(  Started overcloud-controller-1

To have this working 'out of the box' we assume the worst case
scenario of ovirt-engine using a self-signed certificate, so
we explicitly ssl_insecure=1.
Users/Operators should be aware of this and eventually adjust
the value accordingly.

NOTE: this is not a 100% clean cherry pick.

Change-Id: If14e0e0a87cacd857762c955288fd71d052d8bb4
(cherry picked from commit c13c9cf5a2e26b4a27fabc454d99d3643ba3dd42)

Enable staging-ovirt (fence_rhevm) fencing agent.

This commit extends actions/parameters to generate
fencing parameters for nodes using staging-ovirt (fence_rhevm).

Given instackenv.json content like:

{
  "nodes":[
{
  "name":"ctrl01",
  "pm_type":"staging-ovirt",
  "mac": [
"56:6f:71:33:00:0d"
  ],
  "arch": "x86_64",
  "pm_user":"admin@internal",
  "pm_password":"redhat",
  "pm_addr":"10.0.0.141",
  "pm_vm_name":"ctrl01"
}
...

Here the generated fence.yaml:

parameter_defaults:
  EnableFencing: true
  FencingConfig:
    devices:
    - agent: fence_rhevm
      host_mac: 56:6f:71:33:00:0d
      params:
        ipaddr: 10.0.0.141
        login: admin@internal
        passwd: redhat
        port: ctrl01
        ssl: 1
        ssl_insecure: 1

And the resulting pacemaker stonith resource:

stonith-fence_rhevm-566f7133000d        (stonith:fence_rhevm:(  Started overcloud-controller-1

To have this working 'out of the box' we assume the worst case
scenario of ovirt-engine using a self-signed certificate, so
we explicitly ssl_insecure=1.
Users/Operators should be aware of this and eventually adjust
the value accordingly.

Change-Id: I3b746eff8367133cec2c6ff03aad25993d26e90c
(cherry picked from commit c13c9cf5a2e26b4a27fabc454d99d3643ba3dd42)
(cherry picked from commit 54482b4f2ad673f53e2350bd6ac606f94aeb8c08)

[{'created': '2019-08-21 14:38:47.000000000', 'message': 'Mariadb: define timeouts for wsrep

This PS updates the wsrep_provider_options to define the timeouts
explitlcitly for evs.suspect_timeout, gmcast.peer_timeout. Their
defaults are PT5S, and PT3S respectively, which are increased by
a factor of approx 3, to accomdate network instability that may
occur during node outage events.

commit_message:
Mariadb: define timeouts for wsrep

This PS updates the wsrep_provider_options to define the timeouts
explitlcitly for evs.suspect_timeout, gmcast.peer_timeout. Their
defaults are PT5S, and PT3S respectively, which are increased by
a factor of approx 5, to accomdate network instability that may
occur during node outage events.

Change-Id: Ie5cdd06d91299e5e2632b70cb9b50a7ad14f62b1
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

This is now a prerequisite so that we can run external update with
--tags parameter and manage to execute some of those external tasks.
This was probably caused by a a bump in Ansible version or some refactoring
in t-h-t.
The commit [0] inserted the same always tags into the external_upgrade_tasks,
however it was missed for the external_update_tasks. At the same task,
this patch syncs the variables content we pass into external_update_tasks
as many of those variables, which we do pass for the external_upgrade_playbook,
were missing in the external_update_playbook.

'}, {'created': '2019-08-09 10:16:08.000000000', 'message': "Add tags always into external update tasks.

After bumping the Ansible version in Tripleo to 2.6, it was needed
to perform a change in the include module into include_tasks or
import_tasks, as include was getting deprecated [0]. The external
update/upgrades tasks got impacted by that change, but as they use
a loop to execute the tasks we couldn't use import_tasks.
The way include_tasks handles the tasks execution depending on the
tags differs from import_tasks (dynamic vs static) and as a consequence
when running the external upgrade run passing --tags container_image_prepare
we didn't see any tasks running. This behavior got fix in [1], which
seems to be the right way to preserve the import_tasks tags handling as
explained in [2]. But the external update tasks were missed to patch.

This patch includes the tags: always statement inside the external
update tasks and also syncs the variables content we pass into external_update_tasks
as many of those variables, which we do pass for the external_upgrade_playbook,
were missing in the external_update_playbook.

commit_message:
Add tags always into external update tasks.

After bumping the Ansible version in Tripleo to 2.6, it was needed
to perform a change in the include module into include_tasks or
import_tasks, as include was getting deprecated [0]. The external
update/upgrades tasks got impacted by that change, but as they use
a loop to execute the tasks we couldn't use import_tasks.
The way include_tasks handles the tasks execution depending on the
tags differs from import_tasks (dynamic vs static) and as a consequence
when running the external upgrade run passing --tags container_image_prepare
we didn't see any tasks running. This behavior got fix in [1], which
seems to be the right way to preserve the import_tasks tags handling as
explained in [2]. But the external update tasks were missed to patch.

This patch includes the tags: always statement inside the external
update tasks and also syncs the variables content we pass into external_update_tasks
as many of those variables, which we do pass for the external_upgrade_playbook,
were missing in the external_update_playbook.

[0] - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/579844/
[1] - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/639642/1
[2] - https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/30882#issuecomment-380596557
Closes-Bug: #1839520
Change-Id: If7e7b4bbb3cead0887384cc543ce37e9ee5396ab

commit_message:
Add upper-constraints.txt to releasenotes tox environment

Without these dependencies, the releasenotes build does not actually
work.

Change-Id: I76285c90efec07edc25b22a846379e6d600fa036

We're not actually trying to generate secure hashes here, but in the
interest of not triggering automated security auditing tools, let's
not use md5.

Change-Id: I832f0fe03bf3a7f14f924116d1a4927a7f6a3afc

commit_message:
Use sha1 for generating test data

We're not actually trying to generate secure hashes here, but in the
interest of not triggering automated security auditing tools, let's
not use md5.

Change-Id: I832f0fe03bf3a7f14f924116d1a4927a7f6a3afc

subject: Add 'compressed' option to container_format
messages:
[{'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-07-12 07:20:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-07-12 07:20:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-07-12 08:29:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-07-17 21:33:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for proposing this.  There are two issues we need to address:

(1) I'm assuming that all compression formats are identifiable, that is, as far as Glance is concerned, there's just a bunch of bits in there, but whoever is downloading the bits can look at them and determine that this blob is a gzipped file, or a rar compressed file, etc.  Is that correct?

(2) We need to make sure users are clear that (a) simply choosing the 'compressed' container_format doesn't automatically compress their uploaded image, and (b) whether it's useful to have a 'compressed' container_format depends on whether the image consumer knows how to deal with it.  (In other words, Glance is not going to decompress the image data on download.)"}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-07-18 08:01:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Thanks for proposing this.  There are two issues we need to
 > address:
 > 
 > (1) I'm assuming that all compression formats are identifiable,
 > that is, as far as Glance is concerned, there's just a bunch of
 > bits in there, but whoever is downloading the bits can look at them
 > and determine that this blob is a gzipped file, or a rar compressed
 > file, etc.  Is that correct?
Yes, totally correct.
 > 
 > (2) We need to make sure users are clear that (a) simply choosing
 > the 'compressed' container_format doesn't automatically compress
 > their uploaded image, and (b) whether it's useful to have a
 > 'compressed' container_format depends on whether the image consumer
 > knows how to deal with it.  (In other words, Glance is not going to
 > decompress the image data on download.)

I will clarify these two points in the spec.


Thank you very much!"}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-07-18 08:15:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-07-18 08:16:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-07-18 08:43:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-07-18 12:17:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Just a few style things to fix, I think this is OK otherwise.'}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-07-18 14:04:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-07-18 14:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > Just a few style things to fix, I think this is OK otherwise.

Thank you for these comments!
Helps a lot for me!'}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-07-18 14:06:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-07-18 14:28:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

LGTM.  I like that we won't have to introduce specific identifiers for every compressed format."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-08-01 13:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

Please update the spec to include the results of your email query about Nova -- it looks like your patch to Nova to reject images with container_format compressed is acceptable (once you get the tests added).  So add a section after :how:, something like this:

:other impact: Nova cannot currently handle images in a compressed container format.  We propose patching Nova to reject such images: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673407/'}, {'account_id': 30648, 'date': '2019-08-01 14:18:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-08-01 14:46:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

All my concerns have been addressed.'}, {'account_id': 12860, 'date': '2019-08-16 01:52:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

Looks good to me. This matches the discussion Iâ€™ve seen with other projects and the work being done in cinder.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-08-21 15:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Add 'compressed' option to container_format

This spec lite is purposed to support a new container_format
so that we can do image compression when uploading a volume
to glance and decompression when downloading a image from
glance.

Change-Id: Ib5cca6aa4b88edef03c6757879fb58b274811c74

Since being rebased this now fails in test_resource_tracker.IronicResourceTrackerTest 

It looks like a legitimate failure: That test (and thus presumably real installs) expects a newly started compute to _update itself from an existing compute_node record if one exists (and then return). By removing the _upate calls, but still returning, we're removing the chance for the _udpate to ever happen during init of the compute host, instead we have to wait for the periodic job to roll around. From a standpoint of a large install this might be okay, but is not desired behavior in tests."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-08-10 16:12:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-08-10 16:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

_update() does not hit the database unless inventory has changed on the host.'}, {'account_id': 26231, 'date': '2017-08-21 12:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> _update() does not hit the database unless inventory has changed on
 > the host.

_copy_resources before _update(init_compute_node) will cause resource in local memory changed, so _resource_change return true, and _update() will execute twice every period even resource in local memory not changed.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:28:09.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-21 16:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This was fixed with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/520024/.'}]

commit_message:
remove un-necessary update() in _init_compute_node of rt

delete two duplicate _update() in _init_compute_node(), because
_update() while called at end of _update_available_resource.
Too many period db actions in large scale clusters increase the
load of database.

Closes-Bug: #1704179

Change-Id: I1751e237fcb30ab3bce02ad6d130bb6b18dd2bcf

commit_message:
Ensure readiness probe waits for sync pools upon controller restart

This patch ensures the readiness probe is still waiting for the
pools to be sync after a kuryr-controller pod restart. In addition
it also changes the order of syncing pools and cleanup leftovers
ports.

Change-Id: I6aa30ee17fa172d88edd54cd7d1f47212b087d1c

commit_message:
Introduce validation utils

This adds a "validation_utils" module to cloudkitty, which aims at
centralizing common voluptuous helpers.

Work items:

* Create the validation_utils module, and move the "get_string_type" helper
  function to it. API-specific helpers have not been moved.

* Update the module of the "get_string_type" helper function in the
  documentation.

* Add two validators to the "validation_utils" module, allowing to check
  the types of a dict's values and keys.

Change-Id: I938f78b9987fcc4752b84cff8881ceecb5e20caf
Story: 2005890
Task: 35657

commit_message:
Suppress output for ssh-keygen

ssh-keygen has private key which shouldn't be visible in output. This
patch change the behaviour to print only exit code on failure. Also this
patch closes file descriptor once key is read.

Change-Id: I5a286cca6e48b0abc9cec3f15b2648977ae838c2
Related-Bug: rhbz#1734356
(cherry picked from commit b40c9e3b1ca9ed74dd86d002451005faabda89b9)

commit_message:
Remove unused tools/test-setup.sh

CI jobs fail with 'sudo: mysqladmin: command not found' error [1],
however tools/test-setup.sh seems to be unnecessary for the jobs.

[1] https://logs.opendev.org/periodic-stable/opendev.org/openstack/trove/stable/stein/openstack-tox-py27/08d30f2/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-08-15_07_21_37_969034

Change-Id: Ib5445a63825939307d41f34c47756d2f264b604b

[{'created': '2019-08-20 21:01:05.000000000', 'message': 'Rescan after making partition changes

Long story short, we need to rescan after making
partition changes.

Without forcing a filesystem sync and rescan operation,
we rely upon lazy write-out from buffers to the block
device when operating with a ramdisk.

This is because ramfs does NOT actually operate with fsync
where as GNU parted utilizes fsync on the device in an
attempt to force the write to disk to occur. This is fine
if your booted with devfs, or say even a physical block
device that backs /dev, just not ramfs.

Change-Id: I66481d5f3c17a489f7bdf0af82e31b9107605968
Story: 2006423
Task: 36316

commit_message:
Rescan after making partition changes

Long story short, we need to rescan after making
partition changes.

Without forcing a filesystem sync and rescan operation,
we rely upon lazy write-out from buffers to the block
device when operating with a ramdisk.

This is because ramfs does NOT actually operate with fsync
where as GNU parted utilizes fsync on the device in an
attempt to force the write to disk to occur. This is fine
if your booted with devfs, or say even a physical block
device that backs /dev, just not ramfs.

Change-Id: I66481d5f3c17a489f7bdf0af82e31b9107605968
Story: 2006423
Task: 36316

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/602481/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 02m 23s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-21 15:07:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Question came up in IRC today regarding this and ironic node re-balances. If the old compute that was managing a node deletes it and the resource provider:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/7bf75976016aae5d458eca9f6ddac92bfe75dc59/nova/compute/manager.py#L8315

If that node had an instance and allocations against it, when the new compute service re-creates the resource provider, the allocations are lost, right? As of this change anyway because the RT won't refresh the allocations for the node/resource provider managed by the new compute service in the hash ring.

Can you re-balance nodes that have an instance on them?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-08-21 15:18:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Note that I6098d186d05ff8b9a568e23f860295a7bc2e6447 is the change that added the cascading resource provider delete that removes the inventory and allocations for the provider, which was Ocata and predates the time in Pike when we removed the auto-healing of allocations code since the scheduler handles creating allocations since Pike.

So rather than revert this weird ironic-only one off in the resource tracker, we could maybe just change the call to delete_resource_provider to pass cascade=False so if the provider has allocations against it, we'll fail to delete it - at least maybe in the ironic case (since the compute node, ironic node and resource provider all use the same node uuid since Rocky Ia69fabce8e7fd7de101e291fe133c6f5f5f7056a)."}]

[{'created': '2018-09-13 22:34:27.000000000', 'message': 'remove virt driver requires_allocation_refresh

The driver "capability" of requires_allocation_refresh was only needed
for old pre-Pike code in Ironic where we needed to correct migrated
allocation records before Ironic was using custom resource classes. Now
that Ironic is only using custom resource classes and we're past Pike,
rip this code out.

Change-Id: If272365e58a583e2831a15a5c2abad2d77921729
'}]
commit_message:
remove virt driver requires_allocation_refresh

The driver "capability" of requires_allocation_refresh was only needed
for old pre-Pike code in Ironic where we needed to correct migrated
allocation records before Ironic was using custom resource classes. Now
that Ironic is only using custom resource classes and we're past Pike,
rip this code out.

Change-Id: If272365e58a583e2831a15a5c2abad2d77921729

commit_message:
Erase expected GPT locations in metadata wipe

While `sgdisk -Z` is useful to wipe disk and partition
metadata, it will prevent execution and not do anything
if a CRC error is detected with the data already on disk.

We had previously run into this with IPA, however we never
addressed this with-in ironic-lib[0].

[0]: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/1737556
Story: 1737556
Task: 36305

Change-Id: I8fb390cb1daa481583ebcba6a010e9be3255b373

[{'created': '2019-08-20 14:05:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix StateManager.set_state() logic

This fixes the logic of the StateManager's set_state() method: if, by
accident, the state of an identifier is set to the same timestamp as it
currently is at, we won't attempt to create another object.

The 'uq_cloudkitty_storage_states_identifier' constraint was preventing a bug
from happening, but this fixes the code logic.

Change-Id: I530e63dbd67c1357d4aac964fffcdb45ce495768
"}]
commit_message:
Fix StateManager.set_state() logic

This fixes the logic of the StateManager's set_state() method: if, by
accident, the state of an identifier is set to the same timestamp as it
currently is at, we won't attempt to create another object.

The 'uq_cloudkitty_storage_states_identifier' constraint was preventing a bug
from happening, but this fixes the code logic.

Change-Id: I530e63dbd67c1357d4aac964fffcdb45ce495768

commit_message:
Display password_regex_description when password change fails

When keystone has password_regex set and the new password doesn't match
it, the attempt to change the password will fail, and keystone will
helpfully include password_regex_description in its error message.
Unfortunately Horizon discards that and displays "Unable to update the
user password.", which is considerably less helpful.

This change extracts the description from the error message in this
case, and displays it to the user together with a translated error
message. Unfortunately we have no way of also translating the
description.

Closes-bug: #1838003
Change-Id: I535c020deed76188c0f7150072fbdced9c5454fc

commit_message:
Optimize container CLI for getting unique names

Do not call it twice in the while{} loop. It is pointless to
double-check for a container existence after we have determined weither
its name is in use or not.

This decreases the pressure on the container system.

Change-Id: Ife65f082f389ad4a730b3f9cf07d32ac4be32b45
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
